Title: Data Analyst - Digital Marketing (M/W/D)
Description:
Company Description

You'll be joining one of the worldâ€™s largest privately owned real estate tech companies and a subsidiary of Axel Springer. Our mission is to unlock everyoneâ€™s perfect place! You'll work across some of Europeâ€™s best known digital real estate brands including: ðŸ‡«ðŸ‡· Meilleurs Agents, ðŸ‡«ðŸ‡· Groupe SeLoger, ðŸ‡§ðŸ‡ª Immoweb, ðŸ‡©ðŸ‡ª Immowelt, ðŸ‡ªðŸ‡¸ Housell and ðŸ‡®ðŸ‡± Yad2.

Job Description

We are looking for a skilled (Senior) Analyst with expertise in (digital) marketing analytics to join our growing Marketing Analytics team.

As a Senior Marketing Analyst, within the Data Division, you will leverage Google Analytics 4, Adjust (MMP) and internal data sources to analyze our websiteâ€™s and mobile appâ€™s performance, identify key trends, and deliver actionable insights to enhance marketing strategy effectiveness.

You will work closely with our marketing teams to uncover insights that directly impact our ability to optimize user acquisition, engagement, and retention across all channels - ultimately boosting performance.

WE ARE LOOKING FOR AN INDIVIDUAL WHO CAN:


Improve and harmonize our measurement capabilities by collaborating with performance marketing, developers, data engineers and tracking experts.
Support our various brands by conducting ad-hoc analysis and providing detailed dashboards and reports on web and app channel performance
Create and maintain insightful dashboards and reports that monitor performance KPIs such as cost per acquisition (CPA), cost per lead (CPL), lifetime value (LTV) retention rate, and engagement metrics across our web and app platforms.
Collaborate with our performance marketing team to enhance paid media strategies and campaigns (e.g., Meta, Google Ads, etc.).
Conduct deep dive analysis into campaign and channel performance, helping the performance marketing team to understand the impact of their campaigns on key metrics like sessions, leads, conversion, and retention.
Perform cohort analysis to assess the effectiveness of marketing initiatives.
Present actionable insights and data-driven recommendations to stakeholders across marketing and growth teams.
Translate complex data findings into clear, business-focused insights for non-technical stakeholders.
Optimize our marketing spends and improve our ROI across channels by supporting our data science team to further enhance our Marketing Mix Modelling (MMM)
Forecast future trends and performance based on historical data, helping inform performance marketing and growth strategies.


Qualifications

AN INDIVIDUAL WHO HAS:


Several years of experience in analytics, with a focus on (digital) marketing analytics.
Strong experience working with Google Analytics 4 (GA4) or other analytics tools.
Profound knowledge of attribution difficulties and app marketing channels.
Hands-on experience in analyzing web and mobile app data, including user acquisition, retention, and LTV metrics.
Experience working with backend data systems like AWS Athena or Redshift and SQL for querying large datasets.
Experience with visualization tools like Looker and Tableau
Ability to communicate complex data insights clearly to non-technical stakeholders.
Strong collaboration skills and experience working cross-functionally with marketing, tracking, data engineering and data science teams.
Experience with Google Tag Manager (GTM), Adjust (MMP) and advanced Google Sheets skills are a plus


Additional Information

Title: BI Analyst (m/w/d)
Description:
About

Shape our growth with your expertise and personality.

We are a team of more than 1,600 colleagues with the mission to ensure the reliable and affordable supply of high-quality medicines. Aristo Pharma was founded in 2008 through the merger of several traditional German pharmaceutical companies. Today, the group includes a headquarters in Berlin, its own logistics center, five production sites in Germany and Spain, as well as international sales locations. We market generics, prescription original products, and OTC products in 14 countries, making us a well-established player in the pharmaceutical market.

To support our MB Finance department, we are looking to fill a permanent position at our Berlin location as soon as possible:

BI Analyst (m/w/d)

As a BI Analyst, you will play a crucial role in transforming data into actionable insights that drive business decisions. You will work closely with the BI Manager and other stakeholders to understand business needs, develop and maintain BI solutions that drive business growth and operational efficiency.

Key Responsibilities


Collaborate with the BI Manager and other departments to gather and understand business requirements.
Develop BI solutions including creating and updating data models, reports, and dashboards.
Ensure data accuracy and integrity by performing regular data validation, reconciliation on regular basis.
Create User manual for the reports, dashboards and provide support and training to end-users on BI tools and reports.
Maintain the BI platform including managing user access and permission in accordance with the company's data governance policies, maintaining the ETL or data pipelines to ensure its performance and reliability.
Degree in economics, business informatics, or equivalent training (e.g. IT specialization).
Strong analytical mindset, solution-oriented approach, and enthusiasm for data-driven insights.
Being proficient in MS Office, especially Excel.
Experience with data modeling.
Attention to detail and a commitment to data accuracy.
Being familiar with one of the BI visualization tools such as Power BI, Tableau or QlikSense.
Strong communication and interpersonal skills.
Ability to work independently and as part of a team.
Good verbal and written communication skills in English and German.


Preferred Qualifications


Experience with ETL processes and tools.
Knowledge of programming languages such as SQL, Python or R.
Familiarity with cloud-based data platforms (e.g., AWS, Azure, Snowflake).
Active contribution: Choose a secure position at one of Germany's leading generics companies.
Attractive conditions: We offer you financial stability through a compensation package consisting of an attractive monthly salary, Christmas bonus, and a contribution to your company pension scheme.
Work & life balance: Whenever possible, we provide the flexibility you need in terms of working hours and/or location (office or up to three days per week mobile). You also receive 30 vacation days per year.
Onboarding & development: Our onboarding program, supported by a professional and dedicated team, enables you to quickly work independently. Take advantage of our extensive training and development opportunities.
Collegial environment: We offer a friendly atmosphere, open exchange and inspiration, flat hierarchies, and short communication paths. Look forward to employee events as well.
Health & prevention: Benefit from a wide range of health offers. We provide regular health days, fitness partnerships, a canteen with fresh meals, fruit baskets, and occupational health examinations.
Strong focus on mobility: We subsidize sustainable mobility options such as bike leasing or the job ticket.
Corporate benefits: Enjoy financial advantages through employee discounts and perks via benefits.me and corporate benefits.

Title: Freelance Data Analyst (Python) - AI Tutor
Description:
At Mindrift, innovation meets opportunity. We believe in using the power of collective intelligence to ethically shape the future of AI.

What We Do

The Mindrift platform connects specialists with AI projects from major tech innovators. Our mission is to unlock the potential of Generative AI by tapping into real-world expertise from across the globe.

About The Role

GenAI models are improving very quickly, and one of our goals is to make them capable of addressing specialized questions and achieving complex reasoning skills. If you join the platform as an AI Tutor in Data Analysis, you'll have the opportunity to collaborate on these projects.

Although every project is unique, you might typically:


Triple-check some delivery data and ensure client expectations are reflected in every batch
Generate prompts that challenge AI
Define comprehensive scoring criteria to evaluate the accuracy of the AI's answers
Correct the model's responses based on your domain-specific knowledge
Ensure taxonomies are logical, consistent, and aligned with operational needs



How To Get Started

Simply apply to this post, qualify, and get the chance to contribute to projects aligned with your skills, on your own schedule. From creating training prompts to refining model responses, you'll help shape the future of AI while ensuring technology benefits everyone.

Requirements


You have a Bachelor's degree in Statistics, Computer Science, Information Systems, Data Science, Mathematics
You have at least 3 years of professional experience in Data Analysis
You have experience with prompt engineering (basic to intermediate level) and have Basic-to-Intermediate Python Scripting and SQL understanding
You are proficient in spreadsheet tools such as Google Sheets, Excel
You have experience with interpreting data visualization & reporting (e.g., dashboards)
You have a strong command of taxonomy and classification design
Your level of English is advanced (C1) or above
You are ready to learn new methods, able to switch between tasks and topics quickly and sometimes work with challenging, complex guidelines
Our freelance role is fully remote so, you just need a laptop, internet connection, time available and enthusiasm to take on a challenge



Benefits

Why this freelance opportunity might be a great fit for you?


Take part in a part-time, remote, freelance project that fits around your primary professional or academic commitments
Work on advanced AI projects and gain valuable experience that enhances your portfolio
Influence how future AI models understand and communicate in your field of expertise
Show more

Title: Climate Data Analyst (f/m/d)
Description:
Job Description

Weâ€™re looking to hire a Climate Data Analyst for our Climate Science and Impacts Team. You will support, among others, the work of a project on Pacific resilience â€”Building Our Pacific Loss andDamage Response (BOLD Response)â€” which helps Pacific Island countries enhance their capacity to understand, model, and respond to long-term climate impacts. In this role, you will develop high-resolution, downscaled climate hazard projections, analyze adaptation limits, and model long-term risks from both extreme weather events and slow-onset climate processes. These insights will inform national responses and contribute to shaping effective loss and damage strategies for vulnerable island states.

Beyond this project, you will contribute to the work of Climate Analyticsâ€™ Climate Science and Impacts Team by providing analyses on climate impacts and inputs to assessing socio-economic implications in various regions ranging from developing countries to key emitters. You will contribute to tools like the Climate Impact Explorer (https://climate-impact-explorer.climateanalytics.org/) and diverse projects informing e.g. the financial sector about the costs of climate change.

Your Responsibilities


Work with large datasets and conduct statistical analyses for climate modeling
Analyze current and future climate scenarios for different emission pathways
Contribute to risk and vulnerability assessments across sectors (e.g. agriculture, water, urban systems)
Contribute to tools like the Climate Impact Explorer (https://climate-impact-explorer.climateanalytics.org/)
Contribute to assessments of the (socio-)economic implications of climate change
Design and manage databases with climate data, ensuring quality and consistency
Prepare technical and non-technical reports and contribute to scientific publications
Document methodologies and translate findings into policy-relevant outputs
Communicate results clearly to both technical and non-technical audiences
Provide training to partners on climate data tools and risk assessment
Adjust methods in response to emerging issues and stakeholder needs
Showing initiative by developing own ideas and contributing to proposal writing, networking and fundraising.


Your profile

Education And Experience


A Masterâ€™s degree in Earth Sciences, Physics, Climate Science, Environmental Science, Data Science, or a related field
A minimum of 3 years of relevant experience in climate science research and data analysis or a related field.
Demonstrated expertise in handling complex climate datasets (e.g., netCDF, CMIP, CORDEX, ISIMIP) and conducting high-level research on climate change impacts, adaptation, and risk analysis.
Proven experience in working with climate and impact models or working with outputs of those models
Expertise in climate impact modeling for extreme events (e.g. floods, droughts, tropical cyclones, heat waves, wildfires). Experience in assessing economic damages from climate extremes e.g. using CLIMADA, or other forms of economic impact assessments would be an asset.
Experience in engaging with central banks, multilateral financial institutions or more generally the financial sector would be an asset.
Experience in conducting stress testing exercises or familiarity with these exercises would be an asset.
Familiarity with IPCC outputs and loss & damage frameworks is required.
Proven experience working in or with developing countries on climate change issues is an asset.


Skills


Proficiency in Python and R for data processing, statistical analysis, and tool development.
Advanced GIS and spatial analysis skills.
Experience in machine learning, predictive modeling, and integrating quantitative & qualitative data.
Java/HTML skills or other webtool programming skills as well as experience in developing web-tools would be an asset.
Strong motivation and ability to learn new skills.
Strong written and verbal communication skills for effective stakeholder engagement and cross-functional collaboration.
Ability to work independently as well as in teams.
Fluency in English is required
A commitment to the organization's mission and core values, demonstrating integrity and ethical conduct in all professional dealings


Our offer


A job with purpose. With us you will work in a team of highly engaged people and with your skills you can make a positive contribution to our work in the field of climate change.
We are a diverse and inclusive team and welcome your application regardless of your gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, religion, ethnicity, age, neurodiversity, disability status, citizenship, or any other aspect that makes you unique. You will work in a transdisciplinary environment.
We are working in a positive and inspiring working atmosphere with an international team.


Conditions: Fixed-term contract for 2 years

Application Deadline: 04.06.2025

Starting date: As soon as possible

Location: Berlin, Germany

About Us

Climate Analytics is a global climate science and policy institute established in 2008 that delivers cutting-edge science, analysis and support to accelerate climate action and keep global warming below 1.5Â°C. Our international team is composed of roughly 140 staff. Half are based at our headquarters in Berlin, Germany, and the remainder work out of our five regional offices in Africa, Australia & Pacific, the Caribbean, South Asia and North America. Click here to find out more.

Du bist prÃ¤zise, schnell, zuverlÃ¤ssig und motiviert, wenn es um die manuelle Erfassung groÃŸer (Social Media)- Datenmengen geht, aber auch wissbegierig und begeisterungsfÃ¤hig, dich diesbezÃ¼glich kontinuierlich mit Prozessoptimierung zu befassen, sowie dich in Tools und automatisierte Datenerfassungsprozesse und Methoden einzudenken, um immer bessere LÃ¶sungen zu finden.

Datenstrukturierung, Effiziente Datensammlung, Query Writing, Kategorisierung und Datendarstellung werden hier deine tÃ¤glichen Begleiter.

StudiendurchfÃ¼hrung

Von der (manchmal noch recht schwammigen) Fragestellung bis zum fertigen Analysebericht mit guten Insights und Handlungsempfehlungen ist es oft ein weiter aber spannender Weg. Der kann bald auch deiner sein, gemeinsam mit uns im Team.

Du hast ein sehr gutes GespÃ¼r fÃ¼r Sprache und Kommunikation? Nice, das brauchst du hier in mindestens dreierlei Hinsicht: Erstens, um aus den Aussagen und Briefings unserer Auftraggeber herausfiltern zu kÃ¶nnen, wie du ihnen am besten weiterhelfen kannst. Zweitens, wenn es darum geht, die Essenz von Konsumenten-Posts und Kommentaren auf Social Media zu verstehen, schlieÃŸlich ist Inhaltanalyse unser Daily-Business. Und Drittens, um dann Deine Findings Zielgruppengerecht rÃ¼berzubringen - in Reports, in Meetings und bei PrÃ¤sentationen.

Das ist dein Playground. Deine AffinitÃ¤t zu Zahlen und Daten kannst du hier immer wieder beweisen. Ein stets strukturiertes Vorgehen und ein souverÃ¤ner Umgang auch mit groÃŸen und komplexen Datenmengen, Statistiken und Zahlen sind fÃ¼r dich selbstverstÃ¤ndlich.

Spezielle Social Media Analyse-Tools wirst Du ebenso (kennenlernen und) zum Einsatz bringen wie ganz viel Excel und das gute alte Powerpoint.

Das bringst du mit

Du kannst (erste) Erfahrung in der qualitativen und quantitativen Forschungsarbeit, sowie in der marketing- oder kundenorientierten Projektarbeit vorweisen und hast Lust dich im Bereich Social Media Analytics weiter auszutoben. Du hast, dank deines Studiums, einen kommunikations-, sozial- oder medienwissenschaftlichen Background und bringst Kenntnisse der Methoden im Bereich der quantitativen und qualitativen Marktforschung mit. Du hast neben den analytischen FÃ¤higkeiten, auch ein GespÃ¼r fÃ¼r gute kreative Kommunikation und Lust, diese mitzuentwickeln. Du bist organisiert und selbstÃ¤ndig, willst aber auch noch stÃ¤ndig ganz viel lernen und verstehst dich als Teamplayer, der immer auf HÃ¶he des Zeitgeists ist und daraus neue Impulse fÃ¼r unsere Teams und Kunden ableitet. AuÃŸerdem hast Du sehr gute Deutsch- und Englischkenntnisse in Wort und Schrift, sehr gute MS Office Kenntnisse, insbesondere Excel und PowerPoint und bist im besten Fall mit Analytics Tools im Bereich Social Listening & Web Analytics vertraut.

Darum wir

Als Teil der FUSE erfÃ¤hrst du stets RÃ¼ckenwind von deinem Team, arbeitest fÃ¼r Kunden - die unsere Werte â€žBOLD. TRUE. EASY. TOGETHER.â€œ leben und kannst aktiv Prozesse und Strukturen mitentwickeln. Denn ganz getreu unserem Wert TOGETHER setzen wir auf das Potential im Team. Neben unvergesslichen Events bieten wir dir viel Raum fÃ¼r persÃ¶nliche und berufliche Weiterentwicklung.

Title: Marketing Data Analyst (all genders)
Description:
The role in a Snapshot

Are you passionate about disrupting the future of education and to make a real impact? Do you want a career in an edtech company that is innovative and rewarding? Join us and enjoy working alongside an international team of talented thinkers, doers and magic makers.

We are seeking a passionate and experienced Marketing Data Analyst to join our central Data Team. You will play a key role in developing and maintaining our BI infrastructure, overseeing data governance as well as driving actionable insights and making direct impact on efficiency of marketing expenditures.

Location

Berlin (Hybrid)

Your Role in our Mission


Partner closely with Marketing leaders and stakeholders to shape the marketing strategy through data-driven insights and impactful analysis.
Provide and present reports that are actionable for business departments and support the decision making process.
Work closely with Data Analysts and Data Engineers, support and mentor colleagues within Data & business teams to build, maintain and improve the set of current dashboards applying best Business Intelligence practices.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to define, refine, organize and monitor key performance indicators (KPIs) that align with business objectives.
Design and develop Data Models that empowers end users to answer their own questions.
Drive adaptation of new tools & technologies in BI area to maintain a clean, accurate, and efficient data governance framework.
Contribute to data-driven decision making through applying advanced analytics and statistics techniques for assessment of marketing and product tests.


What Will You Bring


Approximately 2 years of experience as a Business Intelligence Analyst / Data Analyst or related role.
Strong Marketing analytics background, with proven experience in digital marketing projects and proven experience in building and evaluating attribution models
Proven proficiency in SQL, with strong experience in building clean and meaningful tables.
Exceptional data storytelling skills, a strong understanding of statistics, and hands-on experience with leading BI tools, specifically Tableau and Superset.
Solid understanding of data warehousing concepts, data governance principles, and ETL processes.
Experience with DBT and Amazon Web Services or other cloud computer platforms
Strong problem solving, analytical thinking and organizational qualities.
Strong communication skills, and ability to effectively collaborate with stakeholders at all levels.


Our way to develop your full potential:


Flexible & focused working: Benefit from our hybrid working model with 2-3 flexible days per week and a Meeting Free Friday for undisturbed productivity.
We grow together: Continue your career with clear development paths and our Spark! Growth & Development program. Get access to 1000s of courses on LinkedIn Learning, our Spark! Mentorship program and monthly learning sessions. Take advantage of 30 free learning sessions to experience GoStudent for yourself
Work Smart, Play Hard: Our regular team and office events ensure a good atmosphere. We believe in team spirit, celebrating together and having lots of fun.
Strength through community: Get involved in one of our GoStudent Employee Resource Groups (ERGs) and stand up for issues that are close to your heart.
All-round support: We are there for you 24/7. Benefit from a comprehensive Employee Support Program - not only for you, but also for your loved ones.


Openness Statement

We value your unique skills and passion. We don't hire based on age, gender, nationality or political opinion - we value your talent and motivation. Even if you're a unicorn - just like GoStudent: do you believe in having a positive impact? Then apply, even if you don't meet all the requirements. Diversity makes us more creative, more innovative and stronger.

Want to find out more? Then visit our career page â€œwho we areâ€!

If you are ready to rethink education with us, develop yourself in an ambitious team and have a real impact - then apply now! ðŸš€

Please upload your CV in PDF format, preferably in English as DOC format may not be supported.

Disclose Privacy & Compliance Information

Title: Senior Data Analyst
Description:
About Yepoda

At Yepoda, Korean effectiveness meets sustainable solutions: our mindfully produced skincare products are made with love in Korea. Our mission is to bring the best beauty innovations from Korea straight to Europe â€“ without ever compromising on our values, quality, and sustainability. All our products are made with the best natural and active ingredients, are vegan and cruelty-free. We aim to make the K-Beauty routine easy, effective, and fun.

Founded in 2020 and located in the heart of Berlin, our beauty start-up is home to a vibrant team of over 80 brilliant human beings from around the globe. Together, we're shaping Yepoda's story.

We are looking for a Senior Data Analyst to support our growing Data team at Yepoda. In this role, you will lead impactful analytics projects across the companyâ€”driving strategic decisions through advanced modeling, cross-functional collaboration, and clear communication of insights.

Your Tasks


Advanced Analytics & Modeling: Build robust data models and perform deep-dive analysis to support initiatives such as forecasting, churn prediction, cohort analysis and marketing performance evaluation.
Cross-functional Collaboration: Partner with teams across marketing, product, and operations to identify data needs and deliver actionable insights.
Marketing Data Expertise: Analyze performance from paid marketing campaigns, influencer activities, and web traffic using platforms like GA4 to optimize ROI and audience engagement.
Dashboard Development: Design and maintain user-friendly dashboards using Looker Studio (or similar tools) to support both high-level KPIs and day-to-day operations.
Self-Service Analytics: Oversee the progress and usage of self-service analytics tools, ensuring they are reliable, accessible, and effective for business users.
Mentorship: Guide and support analytics interns, providing feedback, structure, and learning opportunities.
Stakeholder Engagement: Translate analytical findings into clear, actionable recommendations for both technical and non-technical audiences.
Project Management: Prioritize and manage multiple analytics projects, balancing speed with accuracy and business value.


Your Profile


4+ years of hands-on experience in data analytics or a similar role.
Strong foundation in statistics, data modeling, and data interpretation.
Proficient in Python, SQL, Looker Studio, dbt, git, and Jupyter Notebook.
Experience with marketing analytics, including data from paid ads, influencer marketing, and GA4.
Solid understanding of e-commerce and business intelligence workflows.
Proven ability to work collaboratively with cross-functional teams and manage stakeholder relationships.
Strong communication, problem-solving, and critical thinking skills.
Self-starter with a proactive mindset and a willingness to mentor others.
Experience managing or supporting small-scale projects with multiple deliverables.


What We Offer


Dynamic Environment: The opportunity to work in a start-up environment surrounded by a passionate and dedicated team.
Accelerate Your Career: Take on responsibility from day 1, with room for professional growth and advancement as the company continues to expand.
Inspiring Workspace: Located in the heart of Berlin's Prenzlauer Berg, a dog-friendly office, with free drinks and snacks.
Hybrid Working: We understand that sometimes you get more stuff done from home and need a change of scenery.
We Value Diversity: We seek to build an inclusive workplace that welcomes people from all different backgrounds. A welcoming, international, dedicated team with flat hierarchies and trust by default.
Employee Discounts: Youâ€™ll get to enjoy the Yepoda products at a discount and share it with friends and family.
Unique add-ons: Enjoy an Urban Sports membership package to help you stay active and healthy.


Would you like to be part of the team? Then we'd love to hear from you! ðŸ«°âœ¨

Make sure to apply by clicking on the â€œApply for this jobâ€ button below. Please upload your CV and Cover Letter in English language. Our Talent Acquisition team will review your application and get back to you as soon as possible.

At Yepoda we are dedicated to providing equal employment opportunities to all individuals, regardless of race, color, ethnicity, ancestry, religion, national origin, citizenship, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, age, marital status, parental status, disability, or any other status protected by applicable law.

Title: BESS Data Analyst (m/w/d) for Equipment Health Monitoring
Description:
Job Description

At RollsRoyce Powersystems we develop and build Battery Energy Storage Systems (BESS). Additionally, we offer Long-Term Service Agreements (LTSA). In order to ensure the highest availability possible, we analyze operational data and predict on future scenarios. For this work we need a Data Analyst to develop and improve our Dashboards for our Equipment Health Monitoring (EHM). Therefore, this role is part of our Service Team for BESS.

Tasks â€“ What To Expect From Us


Support our Equipment Health Monitoring Team to create Dashboards for different type of users on our Cloud platform.
Analyzing in-field battery energy storage systems.
Calculating and comparing health and performance KPIs between in-field systems.
In case of on-site problems, perform data analysis and troubleshoot the problems in collaboration with the service team and with engineers.
Create detailed reports describing the issues, root causes, and suggested remedies.
Cooperate with our suppliers and their technical teams.


Qualifications â€“ Who We Are Looking For


Background in electrical engineering and system control and automation.
Very good knowledge of battery energy storage systems and new technologies such as microgrids.
Ideally, previous experience in the battery energy storage system industry.
Very good knowledge of data analysis tools (mainly python) and their different libraries. (Pandas, NumPy, Seaborn and visualization libraries such as Matplotlib, Plotly). Experience in Apache PySpark is a plus.
Proficiency in English and German both written and spoken.
You are able to work independently and have a problem-solving mindset.


Why Rolls-Royce Power Systems â€“ What You Will Get


Company-owned health insurance BKK MTU for our employees and their family members
Comprehensive corporate health management including a company fitness program (EGYM Wellpass)
Attractive company pension scheme â€“ Save for your retirement with us!
Disability insurance â€“ Protection for all cases!
Mobility support in everyday life â€“ JobTicket and JobRad
Corporate benefits program â€“ Great employee discounts on numerous strong brands


We are an equal opportunities employer. Weâ€™re committed to developing a diverse workforce and an inclusive working environment. We believe that people from different backgrounds and cultures give us different perspectives. And the more perspectives we have, the more successful weâ€™ll be. By building a culture of respect and appreciation, we give everyone who works here the opportunity to realise their full potential. You can learn more about our global Inclusion strategy here.

Your contact person

Ana Maria De Los Rios

careers@ps.rolls-royce.com

Note: Please apply exclusively online through our career portal. Applications through other channels (especially via email) cannot be considered.

Type of Contract

Permanent

Title: Data Analyst Intern - Mandatory University Internship (f/m/d)
Description:
Are you looking for a mandatory internship as part of your university program? Join our Machine Learning team at Airteam and gain hands-on experience in a fast-paced startup environment!




We're looking for a Data Analyst Intern who is enrolled in a university program and needs to complete a compulsory internship. Youâ€™ll work with real data, support key business decisions, and gain exposure to cloud technologies, BI tools, and cross-functional collaboration.




Start: ASAP | Location: Remote/hybrid possible




For at least 6 months.


Tasks


Your Responsibilities:





Design Looker Studio dashboards tailored to business needs


Collaborate with Data Engineers: create tickets, track progress, validate outputs


Perform quality checks on existing data pipelines


Implement a data warehouse layer using predefined schema and basic ETL processes


Import and transform data in Looker Studio and support teams with dashboard setup


Support data cleanup efforts to ensure accuracy and consistency


Assist departments like Customer Success, Finance, Product, and Marketing with analytics



Requirements



Youâ€™re enrolled in a university program and looking for a mandatory internship


Basic experience with GCP or other cloud platforms


Familiarity with SQL for querying and manipulating data


Basic understanding of Python


Experience with data visualization and analytics


Strong analytical thinking and good communication skills





Nice to Have:





Experience with data quality checks and pipeline validation


Knowledge of Looker Studio, BigQuery, ETL, or data warehousing


Understanding of customer and financial analytics



Benefits


Join Airteam!




Work with a fun, international team in a cool co-working space in the heart of Berlin. We offer flexible hours, hybrid work, and even workations. Youâ€™ll have the freedom to share your ideas and make an impact. Plus, we love team events and always support your well-being.




Important: This internship must be a mandatory part of your academic program (Pflichtpraktikum).




Apply now and kickstart your data career with us!

  • Ad-hoc Analysen: Du kennst unsere Daten und kannst schnelle, fundierte Antworten auf individuelle Fragestellungen unserer Stakeholder:innen geben.
  • Projektmanagement: Du leitest die Konzeption und Umsetzung von datengetriebenen Projekten â€“ von der Anforderungsaufnahme Ã¼ber die Umsetzung bis hin zur Kommunikation der Ergebnisse.
  • Advanced Analytics: Du entwickelst Prognosemodelle (z.B. Sales Forecasts, Churn Prediction, Lead Scoring) und setzt fortschrittliche Analysen wie Zeitreihenanalysen, Clusteranalysen oder Regressionsanalysen ein, um neue Insights fÃ¼r den Vertrieb zu generieren.

Das bringst Du mit:

  • Relevanter Hintergrund: Du hast ein abgeschlossenes relevantes Studium oder eine vergleichbare Ausbildung sowie entsprechende Berufserfahrung.
  • Reportingerfahrung: Du hast mindestens zwei Jahre relevante Erfahrung im Aufbau von Reports und Dashboards, idealerweise mit Looker Studio oder vergleichbaren Tools.
  • SQL-Kenntnisse: Du bist sicher im Umgang mit SQL, idealerweise in Kombination mit BigQuery.
  • Python-Kenntnisse: Du hast praktische Erfahrung mit Python und relevanten Paketen wie Pandas, NumPy, Scikit-Learn oder Matplotlib sowie solide statistische Grundkenntnisse.
  • Erfahrung mit Tracking-Daten: Idealerweise hast Du Erfahrung im Umgang mit Web- und Apptracking-Daten (z.B. Adobe Analytics).
  • Kenntnisse in fortgeschrittenen Analysemethoden: Du bist vertraut mit Methoden wie Regressionsanalysen, Clusteranalysen, Zeitreihenanalysen, Predictive Modelling und Kohortenanalysen im B2B-Sales-Umfeld.
  • KommunikationsstÃ¤rke: Du kannst komplexe Anforderungen sicher mit Stakeholder:innen besprechen und datenbasierte Insights klar und verstÃ¤ndlich aufbereiten.
  • Sprachkenntnisse: Du verfÃ¼gst Ã¼ber sehr gute Deutschkenntnisse in Wort und Schrift (mindestens Niveau B2).

Das bieten wir Dir:

  • Kreativer Freiraum in einem Team, in dem Ideen geschÃ¤tzt werden und Du Deine Visionen in einem innovativen Medienunternehmen im Herzen Berlins umsetzen kannst
  • Flache Hierarchien mit kurzen Entscheidungswegen und direkter Kommunikation
  • Bezuschusstes BVG-Firmenticket und Zuschuss zur betrieblichen Altersvorsorge
  • Kostenloses Digital-Abonnement von Tagesspiegel & Tagesspiegel Plus, Handelsblatt und die Zeit
  • MÃ¶glichkeiten zur beruflichen Weiterentwicklung durch die Online-Plattform Masterplan, um Deine Karriere voranzutreiben
  • Eine 38,5-Stunden-Woche mit 30 Tagen Urlaub (bei einer Vollzeitstelle), damit Du ausreichend Zeit hast, um Dich zu erholen
  • Flexible Arbeitszeiten und mobiles Arbeiten bis zu 50%

Jede Nachricht erzÃ¤hlt eine eigene Geschichte â€“ und so ist es auch mit den Menschen, die bei uns arbeiten. Beim Tagesspiegel schÃ¤tzen wir die Vielfalt unserer Mitarbeiterinnen und Mitarbeiter und sind fest davon Ã¼berzeugt, dass unterschiedliche Perspektiven unsere Arbeit bereichern.

Wir setzen uns fÃ¼r Chancengleichheit ein und fÃ¶rdern einen respektvollen Umgang miteinander. UnabhÃ¤ngig von Herkunft, Geschlecht, Religion, Alter oder sexueller IdentitÃ¤t â€“ bei uns bist Du willkommen. Lass uns gemeinsam ein inspirierendes Arbeitsumfeld schaffen, in dem jeder seine Einzigartigkeit einbringen kann!

Du denkst, wir sollten uns kennenlernen?

Wenn Du bereit bist, Deine FÃ¤higkeiten in einem inspirierenden Team einzusetzen und einen echten Unterschied zu machen, dann bewirb Dich jetzt Ã¼ber unser Bewerbungsportal https://verlagsjobs.tagesspiegel.de/ und sende uns Deine Bewerbungsunterlagen. Gemeinsam erzÃ¤hlen wir Geschichten, die bewegen!

Wir freuen uns darauf, Dich kennenzulernen!

Title: (Senior) Data Analyst (all genders)
Description:
Your role

We are seeking a curious and versatile Data Analyst who has strong SQL skills and has worked with Tableau to join our team of seven data professionals. The ideal candidate will possess exceptional analytical and problem solving skills, as well as solid communication skills enabling them to share analytical insights effectively with business stakeholders from marketing, operations and the executive layer. The person in this role will serve as a trusted advisor to the stakeholders and contribute to the overall health and quality of the data platform.


Collaborate with stakeholders to understand business requirements and translate them into data analysis tasks
Design and participate in the modelling of KPIs
Advise on and come up with performance indicators and proxies for visualisation of the success of different teams
Work with stakeholders to support them navigate the Data environment, understand and work with the reports relevant to them
Perform exploratory data analysis to identify trends, patterns, and insights that drive business outcomes
Create, verify and maintain visualisations to effectively communicate insights
Suggest actions, based on the data insights and work with teams to develop their strategies


Your profile


Bachelorâ€™s and Masterâ€™s degrees in Social Science or Statistics, with a solid track record as a Data Analyst and a strong emphasis on data manipulation.
Proficiency in SQL, hands-on experience with Google Analytics, GTM, Google Ads, and event data, as well as knowledge of data warehousing (BigQuery) and architecture, is desirable!
Hands-on experience with Tableau; experience with dbt, GetKlar, and TimeSquare is a significant plus!
Understanding of classic e-commerce KPIs and metrics, with the ability to contextualize each data point in relation to others
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills, with the ability to interpret data and extract actionable insights
Excellent communication and presentation skills, with familiarity in multi-cultural environments


What we offer


An appealing discount on all of our products â€“ from essential oils to vitamins & nutrients
We offer 28 days of paid time off per year plus up to 5 days off between Christmas and New Year
The Urban Sports Club membership, Swapfiets bike rental and a subsidy for the BVG ticket
A healthy balance is important to us: we offer a flexible work model and 'workation'
Receive various discounts of up to more than 50 percent on attractive brands such as Flaconi, Bosch, Apple or Expedia
You will be given real ownership and plenty of room for new initiatives, as well as the opportunity to contribute your expertise and implement your great ideas
Inviting office spaces with access to plenty of organic teas and superfoods from around the world
We like to celebrate each other! Regular tea & office parties, Christmas and summer feasts and various influencer events such as Women's Day


Apply with your CV.

Contact

Philipp Klitscher

Apply for this job

About Us

Sunday Natural emerged from a long-standing passion and research in the fields of health, healing, and personal growth. The lack of natural, high-quality products on the market was the original motivation for founding Sunday Natural in 2013. We aim to produce the products we ourselves would love to buy â€“ as natural as possible, absolutely pure, free from any additives, and of the highest quality. In a strategic partnership with CVC, Sunday Natural is now one of Germany's most renowned quality manufacturers, with its own research and development department in Berlin. For the continuous improvement of our products, we collaborate with selected research institutes, scientists, therapists, farmers, and professional associations.

We take our ecological responsibility very seriously: Our entire range is therefore vegetarian, mostly vegan. We also go our own way when it comes to packaging: the majority of our products are packaged in glass and are therefore almost completely recyclable.

We have a diverse team of more than 240 employees from over 40 nationalities, still growing but at a sustainable rate. Our aim is to work in a collaborative, supportive and inclusive work environment with a diverse group of motivated, talented, and visionary colleagues.

We highly value equality of opportunity and inclusivity, and we would like to particularly encourage women and candidates from under-represented backgrounds to apply, even if you donâ€™t match with 100% of the requirements.

Title: Senior Business Intelligence Analyst â€“ Central Reporting (f/m/x)
Description:
Company Description

Our goal is a solar power system on every roof, a storage unit in every house, and an e-car in every garage. How are we achieving this? Enpal makes solar easy: we rent out solar power systems, electricity storage and wallboxes at an all-inclusive rate, supplemented by a low-cost green electricity tariff, and intelligently networked into an integrated overall solution.

We are just at the beginning of our journey to becoming Europe's largest energy company. That's why we're looking for talented people to accompany us on this journey, leave their footprint and celebrate successes together with us. At Enpal, you will find a dynamic working environment as well as the space to develop yourself personally and professionally and to use your strengths effectively.

As the first green unicorn in Germany and the fastest-growing energy company in Europe (FT1000 Ranking 2022 by Financial Times & Statista), we continue to advance our mission of green energy for everyone. Be part of this success story and change the world with us!

Job Description


Strategic Partnership: Collaborate with the VP of Financial BI, VP of FP&A, and C-Suite leadership to align business intelligence strategies with financial goals. Work cross-functionally with Marketing, Sales, and Finance to deliver data-driven insights that support business growth and operational efficiency.
Project Ownership: Manage the intake and prioritization of data projects, ensuring clear goals, scope, and expected impact. Work with stakeholders to refine requirements, prioritize initiatives, and drive execution in alignment with business objectives.
End-to-End Data Solutions: Own the full lifecycle of data solutions, from scoping and MVP development to data modeling, implementation, and validation. Work closely with data engineers, analysts, and business leaders to ensure solutions are scalable and fit-for-purpose.
Data Visualization & Dashboarding: Develop effective, actionable dashboards and data products that translate complex data into clear, intuitive insights. Apply best practices in data visualization to communicate key information effectively across all levels, from operational teams to executive leadership.
Data-Driven Decision Making: Conduct ad-hoc analyses and exploratory data work to identify trends, patterns, and insights. Provide proactive recommendations that drive business performance and ensure ongoing monitoring of key metrics.
Enhancing Data Culture: Elevate analytical standards and best practices within the organization. Share knowledge, refine methodologies, and stay up to date with the latest BI, data visualization, and analytics trends.



Qualifications


5+ years of experience in business intelligence, data analytics, or a related field, with a strong understanding of customer acquisition, finance, and business performance drivers.
Technical expertise in SQL, ETL processes, and BI tools such as Tableau, Power BI, or similar. Our stack includes dbt, Snowflake, Streamlit, and Tableau.
Strong data visualization and dashboarding skills, with the ability to create clear, intuitive, and actionable insights from complex datasets.
Experience with Python or R for data analysis is a plus, particularly in advanced forecasting methods (e.g., econometrics, time series analysis).
Proven problem-solving skills, with experience in automating reporting workflows and leveraging data to improve decision-making.
Strong collaboration and communication skills, with the ability to engage business, analytics, and engineering teams to drive impactful solutions.
Ability to present data products and insights effectively to stakeholders at all management levels



Additional Information

At Enpal, we are proud of the diversity of our team. No decisions are made based on skin color, religion or religious belief, ethnic or national origin, nationality, gender identity, sexual orientation, disability, or age, either during recruitment or employment. We strongly encourage women, neurodivergent people, people of color, and LGBTQ(+) people to apply. Enpal stands for a safe workplace and takes action against discrimination and harassment of any kind.
Show more

Title: Senior Data Analyst - Grow & Engage
Description:
We are seeking an organised and self-motivated Senior Data Analyst to work embedded in our Grow & Engage domain, one of our cross-functional areas to help shape the development of one of the world's leading FinTech products. In this role, you will also have the opportunity to lead, mentor, and coach other analysts, fostering a culture of collaboration and continuous learning within the team.

About The Opportunity

As a Senior Data Analyst you will enable our Product & Business Segments (Acquire, Memberships and Engagement) in the Growth and Engage domain to make data-driven decisions. You are here to establish a data-mindset and thereby to foster a culture of continuous learning and improvement. You will work in a cross functional setup, working closely with other analysts, engineers, designers, and product managers.

In This Role, You Will


Help us set the right goals: Develop clear and measurable targets based on an initiativesâ€™ scope.
Be a strategic partner for Senior Leadership: Driving end to end high complexity analysis on a strategic level in which the business domain is critical to drive overall company success.
Handle stakeholders: Be an internal go-to-person for your teams when it comes to data related questions.
Evaluate initiatives: Support Product experimentation & testing initiatives; design test plans, obtain cross-functional alignment, execute robust analysis, and deliver actionable insights. Share these learnings through clear documentation and concise and empathic communication.
Contribute to self-serve data platform: Help building the right analytics foundations ,by pairing up with technical peers, so our product and business teams can interact with data and extract the right insights themselves.
Provide monitoring tools: Build the dashboards your team looks at every week to make sure they are impacting our company OKRs.
Improve data literacy of organisation: Educate teams to become independent when it comes to data access and understanding function led training and team wide workshops to foster data driven culture.
Be part of our data-community: Collaborate with a broad range of analytics teams at N26 to utilise shared platforms, insights and innovations.
Lead, mentor, and coach other analysts, fostering a collaborative and growth-oriented team environment.
Support some of the following product & business team initiatives (not limited to):
You support your team in discovery of new product ideas, identifying user friction points and business opportunities.
Evaluate your teamsâ€™ continuous releases making sure they are delivering on business goals via experimental or observational methods.
Collaborate with UX researchers to combine qualitative and quantitative research for better product hypotheses.
During product development you make sure all data needed for future evaluation is being captured through set up of tracking events or as part of the backend service.
Drive the quantitative analysis on your segment, being responsible for the insights and business discovery on the team.

Background

What you need to be successful:

4+ years of relevant experience, ideally within the Product or Analytics field.

Skills


Strong understanding of statistical methods used in the analysis of experimental and observational data.
Highly experienced with SQL and Python/R for analytics
Experience working with one or more common data visualisation tools (Tableau, Metabase, Looker, Superset, etc)
Good presentation skills and communication skills.
Having experience in high growth startups managing topics like acquisition, engagement or subscription would be a plus.
Having experience in quantitative research would be a plus.
Having experience in fintech would be a plus.


Whatâ€™s In It For You


Accelerate your career growth by joining one of Europeâ€™s most talked about disruptors ðŸš€.
Employee benefits that range from a competitive personal development budget, work from home budget, discounts to fitness & wellness memberships, language apps and public transportation.
Come together with your team in the office for a dedicated day of teamwork each week, plus another day of your choice, and enjoy the flexibility of remote work the rest of the time. Some roles may require additional in-office presence.
As an N26 employee you will have access to a Premium subscription on your personal N26 bank account. As well as subscriptions for friends and family members.
Additional day of annual leave for each year of service.
A high degree of autonomy and access to cutting edge technologies - all while working with a friendly team of peers of diverse nationalities, life experiences and family statuses.
A relocation package with visa support for those who need it.


Who We Are

N26 has reimagined banking for todayâ€™s digital world. Technology and design empower everything we do and itâ€™s how we are building the global banking platform the world loves to use.

We've eliminated physical branches, paperwork, and hidden fees for an elegant digital experience and supreme savings. Giving people the power to live and bank their way is what gets us out of bed in the morning and inspires the work that we do.

We are headquartered in Berlin with offices in multiple cities across Europe, including Vienna and Barcelona, and a 1,500-strong team of more than 80 nationalities.

Sounds good? Apply now for this position.

Equal Opportunities

We recognize that our strength lies in our people and the varied perspectives they bring to our workforce. We strive to build talented and diverse teams to drive our business success and empower our people to reach their full potential.

We genuinely welcome and encourage applications from people of all backgrounds, cultures, genders, sexual orientations, abilities, neurodiversities, and ages. We're committed to creating an inclusive workspace where everyone feels valued and respected, free from harassment and discrimination. If there's anything you need to make the application process work for you, please let us know by reaching out to candidate.exp@n26.com.

Visit our website to learn more about Diversity, Equity, & Inclusion at N26.

About The Opportunity

As a Senior Data Analyst you will enable our Product & Business Segments (Acquire, Memberships and Engagement) in the Growth and Engage domain to make data-driven decisions. You are here to establish a data-mindset and thereby to foster a culture of continuous learning and improvement. You will work in a cross functional setup, working closely with other analysts, engineers, designers, and product managers.

Title: Senior Data Analyst, Marketing Analytics
Description:
About GetYourGuide

GetYourGuide is the globally leading marketplace for unforgettable travel experiences. Travelers use GetYourGuide to discover the best things to do in a destination. Since its founding in 2009, people from all over the world have booked more than 200 million tours, activities, and attraction tickets through GetYourGuide. Powered by a global team of over 800 travel experts and technologists, we are headquartered in Berlin and have 17 local offices around the world. Visit our careers website to learn more.

Team mission

The Analytics team's mission is to enable the organisation to take action based on data. We work on a variety of problems and datasets as members of cross-functional mission teams. We take ownership of the entire analytics funnel, from exploration through recommendations to impact measurement, and take pride in the insights we generate.

This specific position is within our Marketing Analytics (Attribution & Paid Search) and will focus mostly on helping optimize our Paid Search operations and scaling our investments towards the most incremental and loyal customers. The analyst will need to intervene in our campaign setup and bidding strategies and our attribution and experimentation solutions.

You Will


Develop quantitative analysis and statistical models to evaluate and steer marketing decisions
Maintain and improve our marketing measurement tools (Attribution, experimentation framework, Customer lifetime valueâ€¦)
Explore large datasets, give meaning to data and numbers, identify opportunities and issues, and present findings to stakeholders
Develop new methodologies to scale our Display and Partnerships channel, among others
Serve as a liaison between the marketing teams and the data engineering team
Mentor others in the skills needed for this role


Who You Are


5+ years of relevant experience interpreting data in an analytics, data science or business intelligence role
Strong knowledge of SQL and Python for analysis (eg, pandas, scikit-learn, pyspark)
Ability to understand user behavior and meaning behind the numbers and a track record in sharing insights to business stakeholders
Experience with data visualization and reporting tools (e.g. Looker, Jupyter Notebooks, Databricks)
Prior exposure to digital and performance marketing
Desire to work in an international environment, with minimal direction and with highly engaged individuals
Excellent written and verbal communication skills in English


Nice to have


Knowledge or previous experience of attribution and paid search.
Experience with big data tools (e.g. Spark, Hive) is a plus


How We Set You Up For Success


Meaningful work that helps create memorable travel experiences
A diverse, inclusive environment where your voice is valued
Collaboration with smart, engaged colleagues from over 80 nationalities
English-speaking office environment
Continuous learning opportunities through monthly Hackathons, weekly tech talks, and an annual external training budget
Mentorship programs to support your growth and career development
Flexible working arrangements to support work-life balance
Well-stocked kitchen and team-building events like our famous pizza & beer Fridays
GetYourGuide vouchers and free German lessons
Relocation assistance if needed


And more...

We look forward to hearing from you

Unlock your full potential and join our mission to create unforgettable experiences for millions around the world. If you have the skills and passion for joining our team, we invite you to apply by submitting your CV/resume in English through the form below. Check out how we hire for tips and visibility into our process and check out life at GetYourGuide. If you have any further questions, please do not hesitate to contact us via jobs@getyourguide.com.

We are an equal opportunity employer

Our commitment is that every qualified person will be evaluated according to skills regardless of age, gender identity, ethnicity, sexual orientation, disability status, or religion. Please refrain from including your picture and age with the application.

Title: Data Analyst - Product (d/f/m)
Description:
Our Story

Every year millions of people are either filing their taxes in fear or giving up on their tax refund altogether. We're working on fixing that. Our intuitive app enables anyone, regardless of education or background, to file their taxes with newfound confidence.

Spread across Germany, Spain and the UK, the team at Taxfix Group with its brands Taxfix, Steuerbot and TaxScouts, is a compassionate group of solution-finders. We speak our minds openly, and with over 400 professionals, including tax experts, developers, and IT security experts, we're rich in ideas and voices. The group has facilitated more than 3.5 billion euros in tax refunds for its customers since its founding in 2016

Your Challenge

As a Data Analyst in our Product Analytics team, you will play a key role in shaping data-informed decision-making across multiple mission teams.

Partnering with Product Managers, Engineers, Designers, and other cross-functional stakeholders, you will use data to uncover insights about user behavior across both our customer-facing products and internal tools.

Your work will involve designing and building reports, analyzing feature performance, generating actionable insights that drive product improvements, and contributing to a robust data foundation by helping define and structure the right tracking and data capture.

Your Responsibilities


Analyze user behavior and product usage to uncover trends, pain points, and opportunities.
Define and track key product metrics to measure feature performance and business impact.
Translate complex data into clear, compelling narratives and share insights with a range of stakeholders.
Build dashboards to enable self-serve analytics across the organization, and also up-skill your stakeholders.
Collaborate with the Analytics Engineering to improve our data sources and self-serve solution.


Your Profile


2+ years of experience in a data analytics role, ideally within a product or tech environment
Ability to translate complex data into clear insights and actionable recommendations.
Good communication skills and ability to work with stakeholders across all levels.
Excellent SQL skills.
Experience with data visualization and reporting tools (e.g. Looker, Mixpanel, Tableau).


Nice To Have


Experience with A/B testing and Python are plus.
Data modelling and dbt knowledge are a plus.


Why Taxfix?


A chance to do meaningful, people-centric work with an international team of passionate professionals.
Holistic well-being with free mental health coaching sessions and yoga.
A monthly allowance to spend on an extensive range of services that you can use and roll over as flexibly as you like.
Employee stock options for all employeesâ€”because everyone deserves to benefit from the success they help to create.
30 annual vacation days and flexible working hours.
A generous learning budget to support your personal and professional development and guidance from our internal L&D experts.
Work from abroad for up to six weeks every year. Just align with your team, and then enjoy your trip.
Plenty of opportunities to socialise as a team. In addition to internal tech meetups, our international team hosts regular get-togethersâ€”virtually and in person when possible.
Free tax declaration filing, of course, through the Taxfix appâ€”and internal support for all personal tax-related questions.
Have a four-legged friend in your life? Weâ€™re happy to have dogs join us in the office.


Excited? So are we. Learn more about Team Taxfix on our blog and get a glimpse of our culture.

At Taxfix, we believe that incredible things happen when you have a wealth of perspectives and experiences. We're proudly committed to equal employment and development opportunities no matter your gender, race, religion, age, sexual orientation, colour, disability, or place of origin. To help mitigate any potential unconscious biases, we ask that you refrain from including your picture, age, or marital status on your CV. Let your experiences speak for themselves.

Not sure if you meet all the requirements for this role? Please apply anyway. You might bring something special to the team that we hadn't considered previously.

Title: Senior Data Analyst, Product Analytics
Description:
About GetYourGuide

GetYourGuide is the globally leading marketplace for unforgettable travel experiences. Travelers use GetYourGuide to discover the best things to do in a destination. Since its founding in 2009, travelers from over 170 countries have booked more than 200 million tours, activities, and attraction tickets through GetYourGuide. Powered by a global team of over 700 travel experts and technologists, we are headquartered in Berlin and have 17 local offices around the world. Visit our careers website to learn more.

Team Mission

The Analytics department's mission is to enable the organisation to take action based on data. We work on a variety of problems and datasets as members of cross-functional mission teams. We take ownership of the entire analytics funnel, from exploration through recommendations to impact measurement and take pride in the insights we generate.

As a Data Analyst in the Product Analytics team, you will help drive measurement, strategy, and tactical decision-making within GetYourGuide. You will solve problems that could range from understanding the relationship between review rating and conversion rate, figuring out how to measure adding videos to our product pages, what is the business value of an account login or developing a way to measure whether our customersâ€™ on trip experience is optimal.

Responsibilities


Develop quantitative analysis to drive product decisions.
Help the Search and Discovery group to learn about their features by designing and analyzing experiments.
Design and implement data models, metrics and dashboards to guide the teamsâ€™ product strategy and success.
Support the technical teams in tracking and producing more insightful data.
Contribute to the learning and experimentation culture of the company by promoting hypothesis-driven product development and evaluation.
Answer the big questions to push our knowledge of our customers further.
Contribute to the strategic thinking of the team by being a thought partner to the Product Manager.


Requirements


5+ years of relevant experience interpreting data in an analytics, data science or business intelligence role
Excellent stakeholder management skills.
Strong knowledge of SQL and knowledge of Python
Experience with data visualization and reporting tools (e.g. Looker, Jupyter Notebooks)
Curiosity, reasoning skills with proven evidence of problem solving.
Ability to understand user behavior and meaning behind the numbers
Desire to work in an international environment, with minimal direction and with highly engaged individuals
Ability to navigate ambiguity.
Strong customer focus with a focus on business impact.
Great communication skills


Nice To Have


Previous experience working with agile product teams is a plus.
Previous experience managing analysts is a plus.
Experienced with the statistics and assumptions of experimentation.
Familiarity with ETL technologies like Airflow is a plus.
Experience with big data tools (e.g. Spark, Hive) is a plus.
Experience with LLM APIs (OpenAI, Gemini, Anthropic) is a plus.


We Offer


Meaningful work that helps create memorable travel experiences.
The opportunity to contribute to the
A diverse, inclusive environment where your voice is valued
Collaboration with smart, engaged colleagues from over 80 nationalities
English-speaking office environment
Continuous learning opportunities through monthly Hackathons, weekly tech talks, and an annual external training budget
Mentorship programs to support your growth and career development
Flexible working arrangements to support work-life balance
Well-stocked kitchen and team-building events
GetYourGuide vouchers


And moreâ€¦

We look forward to hearing from you

Unlock your full potential and join our mission to create unforgettable experiences for millions around the world. If you have the skills and passion for joining our team, we invite you to apply by submitting your CV/resume in English through the form below. Check out how we hire for tips and visibility into our process and check out life at GetYourGuide. If you have any further questions, please do not hesitate to contact us via jobs@getyourguide.com.

We are an equal opportunity employer

Our commitment is that every qualified person will be evaluated according to skills regardless of age, gender identity, ethnicity, sexual orientation, disability status, or religion. Please refrain from including your picture and age with the application.

Title: Senior Data Analyst, Product
Description:
Hello, we are AMBOSS and we are looking for a Senior Data Analyst to join our team!

About AMBOSS

AMBOSS is a learning and clinical decision support tool striving to empower physicians across the globe to provide the best possible care. Our founders set out in 2011 to create a tool that they would have hoped to have as medical students and doctors. Since then we have grown to currently operate in 180 countries and have gained immense traction in Germany and the US. Currently, we are pursuing this mission with more than 500+ employees in our offices in Berlin, Cologne, New York, and Cagliari.

Why Data & Analytics at AMBOSS

Join a high-trust, cross-functional team where data is the backbone of every product decision, experiment, and growth bet. Working side-by-side with Product, Engineering, Commercial, and Medical colleagues, you will turn a modern stack into reliable insights and scalable pipelines. Your contributions guide decisions that reach millions of learners and clinicians worldwide, directly advancing our mission to enable doctors to provide the best possible care.

Business Impact

Own the analytics strategy for all AMBOSS product domainsâ€”from user acquisition and onboarding through learning flows, clinical decision support, and commercial touchâ€‘points. Partner with senior leadership to set KPIs, expose the biggest opportunities, and turn insights into roadmap and revenue impact. Guide the analytics craft across the organisation.

Role Overview

A handsâ€‘on yet strategic role: you will lead endâ€‘toâ€‘end analytics initiatives, coach analysts, and advance data quality and experimentation standards.

What You Will Do



Define the analytics roadmap across onboarding, inâ€‘product engagement, clinical usage, and shop flows.
Drive deepâ€‘dives (causal inference, cohort modelling, forecasting) and present recommendations to VP/Câ€‘level stakeholders.
Design, run, and evaluate A/B and multivariate tests; embed best practices across teams.
Own core KPI frameworks and align measurement standards companyâ€‘wide.
Identify data gaps, specify eventâ€‘tracking, and collaborate with Engineering on data reliability.
Mentor midâ€‘level and junior analysts; lead knowledgeâ€‘sharing sessions.
Champion scalable selfâ€‘service tooling and shape the evolution of our analytics stack.



What you bring



5â€¯+â€¯years in product or marketing analytics within SaaS or consumer digital products.
Expert SQL plus strong Python orâ€¯R skills for statistical modelling.
Demonstrated record of translating analysis into product or revenue wins.
Deep understanding of experimental design, causal methods, and forecasting.
Experience with BI / eventâ€‘tracking tools (Looker, Mixpanel, dbt, etc.).
Clear, persuasive communication with both technical and executive audiences.
Proven leadership: mentoring, stakeholder management, prioritisation.



You enjoy



Owning strategic questions endâ€‘toâ€‘end.
Elevating team capabilities.
Balancing quick wins with longâ€‘term analytical foundations.



Benefits

AMBOSSians tell us that innovative work keeps them energized and employee benefits help them to feel appreciated and empowered. We invest in every AMBOSSian with our employee benefits package, crafted to support financial, physical, and mental health, and work-life harmony.

Check out all of our employee benefits in Germany below:

https://go.amboss.com/the-amboss-prescription-de

We believe in diversity as a driving force of innovation and welcome people of all backgrounds to help us achieve our mission of empowering physicians to provide the best possible care - to everyone, everywhere.

About AMBOSS

AMBOSS is a learning and clinical decision support tool striving to empower physicians across the globe to provide the best possible care. Our founders set out in 2011 to create a tool that they would have hoped to have as medical students and doctors. Since then we have grown to currently operate in 180 countries and have gained immense traction in Germany and the US. Currently, we are pursuing this mission with more than 500+ employees in our offices in Berlin, Cologne, New York, and Cagliari.

Title: (Senior) Data Analyst (all genders)
Description:
Your role

We are seeking a curious and versatile Data Analyst who has strong SQL skills and has worked with Tableau to join our team of seven data professionals. The ideal candidate will possess exceptional analytical and problem solving skills, as well as solid communication skills enabling them to share analytical insights effectively with business stakeholders from marketing, operations and the executive layer. The person in this role will serve as a trusted advisor to the stakeholders and contribute to the overall health and quality of the data platform.


Collaborate with stakeholders to understand business requirements and translate them into data analysis tasks
Design and participate in the modelling of KPIs
Advise on and come up with performance indicators and proxies for visualisation of the success of different teams
Work with stakeholders to support them navigate the Data environment, understand and work with the reports relevant to them
Perform exploratory data analysis to identify trends, patterns, and insights that drive business outcomes
Create, verify and maintain visualisations to effectively communicate insights
Suggest actions, based on the data insights and work with teams to develop their strategies


Your profile


Bachelorâ€™s and Masterâ€™s degrees in Social Science or Statistics, with a solid track record as a Data Analyst and a strong emphasis on data manipulation.
Proficiency in SQL, hands-on experience with Google Analytics, GTM, Google Ads, and event data, as well as knowledge of data warehousing (BigQuery) and architecture, is desirable!
Hands-on experience with Tableau; experience with dbt, GetKlar, and TimeSquare is a significant plus!
Understanding of classic e-commerce KPIs and metrics, with the ability to contextualize each data point in relation to others
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills, with the ability to interpret data and extract actionable insights
Excellent communication and presentation skills, with familiarity in multi-cultural environments


What We Offer


An appealing discount on all of our products â€“ from essential oils to vitamins & nutrients
We offer 28 days of paid time off per year plus up to 5 days off between Christmas and New Year
The Urban Sports Club membership, Swapfiets bike rental and a subsidy for the BVG ticket
A healthy balance is important to us: we offer a flexible work model and 'workation'
Receive various discounts of up to more than 50 percent on attractive brands such as Flaconi, Bosch, Apple or Expedia
You will be given real ownership and plenty of room for new initiatives, as well as the opportunity to contribute your expertise and implement your great ideas
Inviting office spaces with access to plenty of organic teas and superfoods from around the world
We like to celebrate each other! Regular tea & office parties, Christmas and summer feasts and various influencer events such as Women's Day


Apply with your CV.

Contact

Philipp Klitscher

About Us

Sunday Natural emerged from a long-standing passion and research in the fields of health, healing, and personal growth. The lack of natural, high-quality products on the market was the original motivation for founding Sunday Natural in 2013. We aim to produce the products we ourselves would love to buy â€“ as natural as possible, absolutely pure, free from any additives, and of the highest quality. In a strategic partnership with CVC, Sunday Natural is now one of Germany's most renowned quality manufacturers, with its own research and development department in Berlin. For the continuous improvement of our products, we collaborate with selected research institutes, scientists, therapists, farmers, and professional associations.

We take our ecological responsibility very seriously: Our entire range is therefore vegetarian, mostly vegan. We also go our own way when it comes to packaging: the majority of our products are packaged in glass and are therefore almost completely recyclable.

We have a diverse team of more than 240 employees from over 40 nationalities, still growing but at a sustainable rate. Our aim is to work in a collaborative, supportive and inclusive work environment with a diverse group of motivated, talented, and visionary colleagues.

We highly value equality of opportunity and inclusivity, and we would like to particularly encourage women and candidates from under-represented backgrounds to apply, even if you donâ€™t match with 100% of the requirements.

Title: Senior Data Analyst
Description:
Senior Data Analyst - 6 Month FTC




Chapter 2 provides technologists to our customers to accelerate innovation and drive their business forward. Specializing in staff augmentation, we embed top-tier technology talent with companies seeking agility, expertise, and seamless integration into existing teams.




We are building a Product Analytics team for one of Europe's largest e-commerce companies and hiring multiple analysts on a full-time, Fixed-Term Contract (FTC) basis.




Data is crucial to developing their products and championing customer experiences. The team will evaluate digital experiences and deliver impactful insights to enhance their personalization, recommendations, browsing, and search experiences.




You'll collaborate closely with product managers, engineers, applied scientists, and business leaders, leading data exploration, A/B testing, and hypothesis analysis to deeply understand their customers and products. Youâ€™ll also track and report key performance indicators (KPIs).




The Role:




Define analytical strategies, align stakeholders, and independently deliver impactful insights.
Deeply analyze user behaviors to drive product growth and improvements.
Influence product decisions through robust, data-backed recommendations.
Define and monitor essential product KPIs.
Design, analyze, and interpret A/B tests and quasi-experiments.
Act as a stakeholder liaison to align and communicate effectively around data insights.




About You:




Experience in analytics roles (Digital Analytics, Product Analytics, Business Intelligence), preferably in e-commerce.
Strong understanding of e-commerce KPIs and SQL (including nested/repeated data).
Proficiency in advanced analytics tools, preferably Python, and familiarity with statistical modeling.
Expert knowledge of A/B testing methodologies.
Experience analyzing user behavior data (e.g., Google Analytics).
Strong communication skills, capable of clearly presenting insights to technical and non-technical stakeholders.




Diversity, Equity & Inclusion at Chapter 2




At Chapter 2, we are committed to building a diverse, inclusive, and welcoming workplace where everyone belongs. Regardless of race, ethnicity, religion, age, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, disability, or neurodiversity, we celebrate the unique perspectives that make us stronger. We encourage applications from all backgrounds and will accommodate any recruitment or interview adjustments needed to create a smooth and comfortable experience. Your individuality matters, and we believe that diverse philosophies, cultures, and experiences drive innovation and success.

Show more
