Title: TikTok LIVE Data Analyst
Description:
Responsibilities
The LIVE Operations team is obsessed with everything to do with TikTok LIVE. Our focus is to continually champion and optimize TikTok LIVE through working with creators to ensure a creative, fun and safe space for all of our users.

The Regional LIVE Operation Strategy Team leads various cross-functional projects. Our key initiatives include developing strategic plans to drive widespread adoption of LIVE at scale among creators, localizing new product features, creating user engagement strategies, ensuring a positive creator experience through education on the Community Guidelines and best practices, and providing ad hoc analysis and support to cross-functional partners.

Responsibilities:
- Analyzing local and global trends to help improve performance within the EU LIVE team
- Creating and preparing reports and dashboards to help us better identify areas of focus and trends within our ecosystem

Examples of Problems You'll Be Solving:
- What are the best content verticals for us to focus our creator recruitment on?
- Building a prediction model for identifying creators who may be destined for success on our platform
- Which metrics and leading and lagging indicators should we use for our key OKRs?
- How should we best segment our creators and users to have a more meaningful impact on their growth?
- What are the best touch-points to educate our creators, and when should we activate this education?
- Using statistical tools to simplify complex data sets, helping us better diagnose issues and propose solutions

Qualifications
Minimum Qualifications:
- Minimum 3 years of working experience in data analysis
- Strong mathematical skills to measure, collect, and analyze data
- Attention to detail

Preferred Qualifications:
- Proficiency in statistics and experience using data visualization software such as Tableau, PowerBI, or Looker
- Knowledge of SQL and any programming languages (Python is highly preferred)

About TikTok
TikTok is the leading destination for short-form mobile video. At TikTok, our mission is to inspire creativity and bring joy. TikTok's global headquarters are in Los Angeles and Singapore, and we also have offices in New York City, London, Dublin, Paris, Berlin, Dubai, Jakarta, Seoul, and Tokyo.â€‹


Why Join Us
Inspiring creativity is at the core of TikTok's mission. Our innovative product is built to help people authentically express themselves, discover and connect â€“ and our global, diverse teams make that possible. Together, we create value for our communities, inspire creativity and bring joy - a mission we work towards every day.â€‹
We strive to do great things with great people. We lead with curiosity, humility, and a desire to make impact in a rapidly growing tech company. Every challenge is an opportunity to learn and innovate as one team. We're resilient and embrace challenges as they come. By constantly iterating and fostering an "Always Day 1" mindset, we achieve meaningful breakthroughs for ourselves, our company, and our users. When we create and grow together, the possibilities are limitless. Join us.â€‹
â€‹
Diversity & Inclusionâ€‹
TikTok is committed to creating an inclusive space where employees are valued for their skills, experiences, and unique perspectives. Our platform connects people from across the globe and so does our workplace. At TikTok, our mission is to inspire creativity and bring joy. To achieve that goal, we are committed to celebrating our diverse voices and to creating an environment that reflects the many communities we reach. We are passionate about this and hope you are too.â€‹

Title: Junior Data Analyst
Description:
Foster + Partners

Junior Data Analyst

London, Battersea

Permanent




We are a global studio for sustainable architecture, urbanism, engineering and design, founded by Norman Foster in 1967.




Responsibilities:

Creating and maintaining PowerBI reports
Using Power Query, M and DAX to create measures, calculated columns and tables.
Modelling the data to produce efficient reports using a Star schema and understanding and creating the appropriate relationships within the model.
Monitor and maintain the refresh and usage of the live reports on the PowerBI service.
Analyse, filter and cleanse data by reviewing reports and performance indicators to locate issues and gaps.
Interpret data, analyse results using statistical techniques and provide ongoing reports.
Adhere to Foster + Partners Digital Design Guidelines
Acquire data from primary or secondary data sources and maintain databases/data systems
Identify, analyst and interpret trends or patterns in complex data sets.
Create and implement effective metrics and monitoring processes.




In return we offer a competitive basic salary and generous benefits package which includes 25 days holiday (exc bank holidays), Pension, DIS and discretionary annual bonus

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
About Us

Philanthropy & Alumni Engagement (P&A) provides a fundraising and alumni engagement function in support of Kingâ€™s College London. We are proud to work with colleagues across the university and its health partners to help them serve society through world-leading education, research and healthcare. Our work also includes a partnership with the Maudsley Charity in support of childrenâ€™s mental health initiatives between the universityâ€™s Institute of Psychiatry, Psychology and Neuroscience and the South London & Maudsley NHS Trust.

We are a committed team that brings together fundraisers working across different channels, alongside colleagues who promote Kingâ€™s College Londonâ€™s engagement with its worldwide alumni community. Our work is underpinned and enhanced by a range of dedicated professionals in supporting areas covering proposition development, supporter engagement, supporter operations and business operations.

We have an impressive, well-established track record of success in securing support that allows the university and partners to deliver on their missions. This includes our global, award-winning World Questions: Kingâ€™s Answers campaign, which set the standard in the sector and enabled us to raise substantial funds to help tackle some of the worldâ€™s biggest challenges. Ambitious and innovative, the team has won awards such as a CASE Platinum Award for Fundraising and a CASE Gold Award for Donor Relations and Stewardship. We are strongly values-driven with a focus on sustaining an excellent and supportive culture, which we see as key to creating a successful team that can support the university and its partners in making a real and positive difference to the world we live in.

More on Kingâ€™s College London

Kingâ€™s College London is an internationally renowned university delivering exceptional education and world-leading research. The university is dedicated to driving positive and sustainable change in society and realising our vision of making the world a better place. Through its commitment to exceptional education, impactful research and genuine service to society, Kingâ€™s College London is creating positive change in its communities, both in London and on the world stage. The Strategic Vision 2029 looks forward to Kingâ€™s College Londonâ€™s 200th anniversary in 2029 and sets out ambitious plans in five key areas:

Educating the next generation of change-makers;
Challenging ideas and driving change through research;
Giving back to society through meaningful service;
Working with our local communities in London;
Fostering global citizens with an international perspective.




About the role

The Data Analyst works within the Data Team, using and transforming data from multiple sources to produce high quality, digestible reports, dashboards, and bespoke pieces of analysis for our fundraising and alumni colleagues. You will also lead on any benchmarking projects, both the submission of data and the interpretation and presentation of their findings. Being a clear communicator of often complex information, you will deliver insight into the performance of our various fundraising and engagement programmes, giving colleagues the information they need to continually innovate and improve.

In addition, you will have a raft of technical skills and approaches that will enable you to efficiently transform source data from multiple data sources ready for import into our Dynamics CRM system.

You will be keen to learn and develop, embracing new technologies and ways of working, and will work with the Data Team and others across the department to improve the quality of the underlying data we all rely on. You will also work closely with others in the team, IT colleagues and other users across the organisation to shape future CRM features.

You will be required to liaise and work collaboratively with other teams on new fundraising projects and initiatives, thereby ensuring a joined-up approach, that future reporting requirements can be met, with learning shared and insight retained. You will often need to manage multiple requests and prioritise your workload, albeit we have adopted an Agile approach to development.

This is a full time post (35 hours per week), and you will be offered an indefinite contract. P&A has a hybrid working approach, with a minimum of 40% of time in the office. Typically, this equates to two days per week, but weâ€™re very happy for colleagues to be in more frequently if they so wish.




About You

To be successful in this role, we are looking for candidates to have the following skills and experience:

Essential criteria

Knowledge of data insight, analysis and reporting techniques
Significant experience of working with a fundraising or marketing CRM in a technical, database management or report writing capacity
Strong SQL skills
Experience of building reports and dashboards using Power BI or other data visualization tools
Ability to create data transformations using tools such as Power Query, Power Automate and/or VBA macros
Experience of manipulating large or complex datasets
Ability to communicate often complex and technical information in a clear and digestible way to a wide range of stakeholders, both internal and external
Experience of managing conflicting deadlines and multiple priorities




Desirable criteria

Knowledge of data modelling/ analysis techniques
Experience of using Microsoft Dynamics and its associated applications such as Customer Insights
Experience of building dashboards within Microsoft Dynamics
Knowledge of other programming languages, such as DAX and M
Restless enthusiasm for learning new technologies and improving processes

Kingâ€™s College London is an internationally renowned university delivering exceptional education and world-leading research. The university is dedicated to driving positive and sustainable change in society and realising our vision of making the world a better place. Through its commitment to exceptional education, impactful research and genuine service to society, Kingâ€™s College London is creating positive change in its communities, both in London and on the world stage. The Strategic Vision 2029 looks forward to Kingâ€™s College Londonâ€™s 200th anniversary in 2029 and sets out ambitious plans in five key areas:

  • Educating the next generation of change-makers;
  • Challenging ideas and driving change through research;
  • Giving back to society through meaningful service;
  • Working with our local communities in London;
  • Fostering global citizens with an international perspective.


About the role

The Data Analyst works within the Data Team, using and transforming data from multiple sources to produce high quality, digestible reports, dashboards, and bespoke pieces of analysis for our fundraising and alumni colleagues. You will also lead on any benchmarking projects, both the submission of data and the interpretation and presentation of their findings. Being a clear communicator of often complex information, you will deliver insight into the performance of our various fundraising and engagement programmes, giving colleagues the information they need to continually innovate and improve.

In addition, you will have a raft of technical skills and approaches that will enable you to efficiently transform source data from multiple data sources ready for import into our Dynamics CRM system.

You will be keen to learn and develop, embracing new technologies and ways of working, and will work with the Data Team and others across the department to improve the quality of the underlying data we all rely on. You will also work closely with others in the team, IT colleagues and other users across the organisation to shape future CRM features.

You will be required to liaise and work collaboratively with other teams on new fundraising projects and initiatives, thereby ensuring a joined-up approach, that future reporting requirements can be met, with learning shared and insight retained. You will often need to manage multiple requests and prioritise your workload, albeit we have adopted an Agile approach to development.

This is a full time post (35 hours per week), and you will be offered an indefinite contract. P&A has a hybrid working approach, with a minimum of 40% of time in the office. Typically, this equates to two days per week, but weâ€™re very happy for colleagues to be in more frequently if they so wish.


About You

To be successful in this role, we are looking for candidates to have the following skills and experience:

Essential criteria

  1. Knowledge of data insight, analysis and reporting techniques
  2. Significant experience of working with a fundraising or marketing CRM in a technical, database management or report writing capacity
  3. Strong SQL skills
  4. Experience of building reports and dashboards using Power BI or other data visualization tools
  5. Ability to create data transformations using tools such as Power Query, Power Automate and/or VBA macros
  6. Experience of manipulating large or complex datasets
  7. Ability to communicate often complex and technical information in a clear and digestible way to a wide range of stakeholders, both internal and external
  8. Experience of managing conflicting deadlines and multiple priorities


Desirable criteria

  1. Knowledge of data modelling/ analysis techniques
  2. Experience of using Microsoft Dynamics and its associated applications such as Customer Insights
  3. Experience of building dashboards within Microsoft Dynamics
  4. Knowledge of other programming languages, such as DAX and M
  5. Restless enthusiasm for learning new technologies and improving processes

Title: Research Data Analyst
Description:
An exciting opportunity to be involved at the cutting edge of life sciences innovation in east London. This role is for a talented Research Data Analyst to work on projects and applications that will develop and use AI and machine learning as the primary means of delivering innovative health care products and services including to enhance cancer disease detection, diagnosis and treatment as part of PharosAI at Barts Health. They will join a growing team which is focused on AI and reproducible applications of healthcare data to deliver innovative health care products and services to the front line. Barts Health has been awarded Â£4.3m as part of Â£18.9m in funding from the Department for Science, Innovation and Technology to support the PharosAI project by providing expertise in AI development and ensuring that data from the Barts Health Data Platform as well as Barts' local tissue bank informs the building of the new AI models. These datasets will allow commercial and academic researchers to interrogate, develop and validate AI algorithms for the benefit of people in North East London, the UK and beyond. The project touches both on artificial intelligence and clinical patient benefit.

Fixed Term until 31/03/28

Barts Life Sciences is our programme for using research, innovation and technologies to transform health and care services. This covers a broad range of activities from discovery science, product development and testing, and the application of new technology. Life sciences in Whitechapel is firmly based on the principles of partnership and collaboration, with patients, a large number of highly engaged primary care providers, a wide range of commercial and other academic partners, local government and the local community. These partnerships will be founded on a common ambition and desire to achieve profound health, economic and social benefit for the people of east London, the UK, and internationally.

As part of Barts Life Sciences, the postholder will have access to data and computation power, knowledge and innovation to lead the projectâ€™s development and genuinely impact patient care. We have a close network of clinical teams across the Trust, research groups at Queen Mary University of London and engaged patient groups to priorities and spread project outputs.

Barts Health is one of the largest NHS trusts in the country, and one of Britainâ€™s leading healthcare providers.

The Barts Health group of NHS hospitals is entering an exciting new era on our improvement journey to becoming an outstanding organisation with a world-class clinical reputation. Having lifted ourselves out of special measures, we now have the impetus and breathing space to chart a fresh course in which we are continually striving to improve all our services for patients.

Our vision is to be a high-performing group of NHS hospitals, renowned for excellence and innovation, and providing safe and compassionate care to our patients in east London and beyond. That means being a provider of excellent patient safety, known for delivering consistently high standards of harm-free care and always caring for patients in the right place at the right time. It also means being an outstanding place to work, in which our WeCare values and behaviours are visible to all and guide us in how we work together.

We strive to live by our WeCare values and are committed to promoting inclusion, where every staff member has a sense of belonging. We value our differences and fully advocate, cultivate and support an inclusive working environment.

For further details / informal visits contact: Name: Concetta Piazzese Job title: Research Data Engineer Email address: c.piazzese@nhs.net

Title: Junior Data Analyst (m/f/d)
Description:
Junior Data Analyst â€“ Google Sheets

Location: London

Duration: 3 months

About the Role:

We are looking for a motivated Junior Data Analyst to support our risk management team by extracting and compiling data for monthly risk reports. This is an excellent opportunity for someone early in their data career who wants to develop their skills in SQL, Google Sheets, and working with large datasets like those in BigQuery, while gaining exposure to risk management practices.

Key Responsibilities:


Assist in extracting data from the central Risk system using SQL queries.
Compile and organize data manually into monthly risk management reports using Google Sheets.
Work closely with senior team members to ensure data accuracy and consistency
Learn to handle large datasets using BigQuery under guidance.
Maintain strong attention to detail in all data-related tasks.
Support ongoing efforts to improve reporting processes within the team.


Must-Have Qualifications:


Basic experience with SQL and comfort writing simple queries
Proficiency in Google Sheets including functions and data organization.
Willingness to learn and develop skills in BigQuery or similar data platforms.
Strong attention to detail and a methodical approach to work.
Good communication skills and ability to collaborate effectively in a team.
Some familiarity or interest in risk management or financial services.
Exposure to or interest in data visualization tools such as Google Data Studio, Tableau, or Power BI.
Experience or coursework involving data analysis or reporting.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
About Iglu Why You'll Love Working Here

At Iglu.com, we're more than just a travel company â€” weâ€™re the UKâ€™s leading online cruise retailer, and weâ€™re redefining what it means to book a cruise in the digital age.

Working At Iglu Means


ðŸ’¬ Flat structure, real impact â€“ Your ideas matter. Everyone contributes, and youâ€™ll see the results of your work fast.
ðŸŒ´ Cruise perks & travel love â€“ Weâ€™re in the business of adventure, and youâ€™ll feel it.
ðŸ§  Smart, supportive people â€“ Join a talented, close-knit team that genuinely enjoys solving hard problems together.
ðŸš€ Room to grow â€“ Weâ€™re on a transformation journey, and thereâ€™s huge opportunity to shape the future with us.
Training and development - Paid for training, conferences and certification e.g. AWS Certs.


We combine a passion for travel with a love for technology, delivering smart, seamless customer experiences and building platforms that handle the complexity of modern cruising â€” all while keeping things collaborative and fun.

About The Role

You will be working within our Analytics team, cross functionally serving different areas of our growing travel business.

Data At Iglu

This is an exciting opportunity to join a growing and crucial function of the business, your day to day responsibilities will be to generate insight, ensure effective communication and adoption into the business processes.

Analysing data, identifying trends, forecasting and modelling to make recommendations to the business. This is a varied role, looking at all aspects of the business, and will require a good work ethic and an ability to work quickly and diligently. This is an opportunity to have a positive impact on the business by driving change and continuous improvement, and evaluating the impact of these changes.

Responsibilities


Interrogate and analyse data to establish market and product trends, find new opportunities, improve efficiency and build forecasts models, across the cruise sectors
Present findings & recommendations to the management team to support the running of the business, drive growth and efficiencies;
Work alongside the BI Team, to validate data and facilitate new data points and sources;
Work closely with other departments to ensure their reporting needs are being met, help identify new areas for analysis as required;
Create daily, weekly and ad-hoc reporting on performance, trends and opportunities;
Produce written documentation to support your work, report on your findings an to present to stakeholders when necessary;
Provide continued reporting and evaluation on the impact of changes made;


Key Skills


Proven project experience with SQL, experience with Python packages a plus
Proficiency with data visualisation software (Tableau preferred)
Business acumen, a passion in learning how businesses operate, which strategies are implemented and which industry trends buffet and boost the business.
Microsoft office/G Suite proficiency, especially with Excel


About You


Have an appetite for personal development
Display great self awareness around time management and prioritisation
Are diligent and conscientious
Show adaptability and resilience
Have personal drive
Are focused
Are trusted by others and offer support
Communicate well with others within their own department and across the business
Show accountability and embrace responsibility
Have previous g-suite experience

Â£50,000
London (Chiswick)

Title: FIU Data Analyst
Description:
About MoonPay ðŸŒ–ðŸ’¸
Hi, weâ€™re MoonPay. Weâ€™re here to onboard the world to Web3.

Why? Because we think Web3 is a unique and democratising technology. It gives people back control of their money, digital identity, data, and property like nothing else before it.

What We Do
Weâ€™re the leading infrastructure company in Web3. This means we offer our partners everything from payment solutions (we call them 'Ramps') to minting software for digital collectibles, like NFTs. And over 30 million people around the world now trust our products â€” just take a look on Trustpilot.

Weâ€™re also big on collaborations. And we've worked on stunts, drops, and partnerships with some of the world's most prestigious and forward-thinking brands.

But thatâ€™s not all. We have also built our own consumer app because we wanted to see if we could build a better Web3 account. Itâ€™s taken off in a big way, and we're working hard to continually improve it and to strive for perfection.

So whatever your background, weâ€™re sure thereâ€™s something for you here. Come help us build the future of Web3 and digital ownership.

ðŸŒ” About the Opportunity

The Financial Intelligence Unit (FIU) is responsible for safeguarding the MoonPay platform against financial crime and money laundering activities. Leveraging advanced analytics and blockchain tracing tools, it collects and analyses huge volumes of data to identify potentially suspicious activities. The team collaborates with regulatory bodies, submitting suspicious activity reports (SARs) and sharing intelligence to combat financial crime.

The FIU Data Analyst will directly support the Compliance Technology Manager to govern the MoonPay Compliance tech stack and data science needs. This role ensures adherence to regulatory requirements and internal policies by directly supporting the FIUâ€™s data science, analytics, and reporting needs. This is also a global role that will support all operating businesses in the MoonPay family across the U.S., UK, Europe and beyond.

Locations: (London Hybrid)

ðŸš€ What you will do



Develop and maintain dashboards and reporting to monitor key compliance metrics
Manage incoming data requests from global regulators, ensuring data is provided quickly and accurately
Identify trends and anomalies using advanced data analysis techniques and tools
Support financial crime investigations by providing insights from complex datasets
Maintain documentation on the compliance data stack, supporting audits and model validations
Support the compliance team with ad-hoc data analyses, and act as a trusted point of contact for all compliance data needs
Communicate your findings with stakeholders across the team and wider company





ðŸ§‘â€ðŸš€ About You



Bachelor's degree in Data Science, Computer Science, Finance, or a relevant technical field. Masters degree or above is a plus
2+ years proficiency in data analysis tools including SQL and Python
Strong knowledge of data visualization tools such as Looker or Tableau
Exceptional problem-solving skills and attention to detail
Team player with good communication skills, with the ability to explain technical concepts clearly to different audiences
Ability to handle shifting priorities and thrive in a dynamic environment. Comfortable to work independently and upskill on new tools and technology
Interested in cryptocurrency, blockchain and financial crime detection





Bonus points for:


Prior experience working in a fast-paced fintech/cryptocurrency company
Experience with cloud data services such as GCP, Snowflake or AWS
Prior familiarity with AML (Anti-Money Laundering) rules and transaction monitoring
Knowledge of key blockchain concepts and on-chain data structure





ðŸ’» What you will be working with/on

You will be at the forefront of safeguarding MoonPay against financial crime. In this role, you'll contribute to building a secure, compliant ecosystem by supporting efforts to identify risks and protect against illicit activities in the evolving world of blockchain and digital assets. This is an exciting opportunity to be part of a dynamic and innovative team that values collaboration, adaptability, and making a meaningful impact in the cryptocurrency space.

Most importantly, though, you will embody the core principles that everyone here at the MoonPay lives by. Our â€œBLOCK Valuesâ€ are at the heart of everything we do - and they areâ€¦

B - Be Hungry

L - Level Up

O - Own It

C - Crypto Curious

K - Kaizen

MoonPay Perks
Equity package ðŸ“ˆ

Unlimited holidays ðŸ

Paid parental leave ðŸ¼

Annual training budget ðŸ’»

Home office setup allowance ðŸª‘

Monthly budget to spend on our products ðŸ’°

Working in a disruptive and fast-growing industry where the possibilities are endless ðŸš€

Freedom, autonomy and responsibility ðŸ’ª

Research has shown that women are less likely than men to apply for this role if they do not have experience in 100% of these areas. Please know that this list is indicative, and that we would still love to hear from you even if you feel that you are only a 75% match. Skills can be learnt, diversity cannot.

Please let us know if you require any accommodations for the interview process, and weâ€™ll do our best to provide assistance.
Commitment To Diversity
At MoonPay we believe that every voice matters. We strive to create a mindful and respectful environment where everyone can bring their authentic self to work, and experience a culture that is free of harassment, racism, and discrimination. Thatâ€™s why we are committed to diversity and inclusion in the workplace and are a proud equal opportunity employer. We prohibit discrimination and harassment of any kind based on race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, disability, protected veteran status or any other characteristic protected by law. This policy applies to all employment practices within our organization, including, but not limited to, hiring, recruiting, promotion, termination, layoff, and leave of absence.

MoonPay is also committed to providing reasonable accommodations in our job application procedures for qualified individuals with disabilities. Please inform our Talent Team if you need any assistance completing any forms or to otherwise participate in the application process.

Please be aware that MoonPay does not request an AI-led interview without seeing a recruiter or team member from MoonPay on video call. We won't ask for your personal identification documents or any money from you during your interview process with us. Be fraud smart! If you receive an email - claiming to be from MoonPay - but from an email address ending in anything other than @moonpay.com, please be aware that this is not us.

We won't ask for your personal identification documents or any money from you during your interview process with us. Be fraud smart! If you receive an email - claiming to be from MoonPay - but from an email address ending in anything other than @moonpay.com, please be aware that this is not us.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Data Analyst (1 Year Maternity Cover)

Â£35,000 - Â£40,000 + 10% bonus + benefits

London (2 days per week in the office)




Our client




Our client is a global strategic technology and payments partner. They deliver seamless personalised shopping experiences to over 29m international shoppers, who in turn generate â‚¬22.9bn revenue.




With 2,000 employees spread across 50 countries, they integrate with 300,000 point of sale systems in a number of luxury retailers and brands including Harrods, Selfridges, John Lewis, Libertyâ€™s, Apple, Cartier, De Beers, HermÃ¨s, Rolex, Dior and Jimmy Choo.




Their products include tax-free shopping, smart data and intelligence, marketing and sales, POS technology and payment solutions.




The role




The Data Analyst will help the business to understand customer needs and behaviours through the analysis of complex data sets and subsequent translation into meaningful, shareable insights and stories.




This role will be hands on with building visualisations in Tableau and ad hoc analysis (using SQL) to inform the optimisation of products and features.




As a Data Analyst, you will:




Monitor and report on key KPIs.
Deep-dive (using SQL) into customer data to provide product teams with detailed customer analysis.
Be hands-on with building visualisations in Tableau.
Identify data requirements, working with international data teams to ensure data is cleansed and prepared.
Support with the identification of new and innovative ways to leverage data to deliver new customer engagement opportunities, optimise channels and deliver economic efficiency.
Deliver enhanced customer profiling and segmentation.
Measure the effectiveness of customer-facing products, features and campaigns.
Provide ad-hoc analysis to inform the optimisation of customer-facing products, features and campaigns.
Advise on how advanced statistical and analytical techniques can further improve the understanding of customers.




To apply, you should have




Experience working as a Data Analyst with good exposure to statistical methodologies.
Intermediate SQL skills.
Advanced experience with Tableau (or a similar tool).
Advanced Excel skills.
Proven experience delivering impactful and actionable insights with a B2C environment.




The perks include




25 days holiday + bank holidays.
An extra day off for moving to a new house; 2 days off for your wedding; 3 days off for charity / community days.
Private healthcare and medical cashback plan.
Perkbox.
Competitive pension plan.
Virgin gym membership.




Match Digital specialises in connecting talented individuals with businesses in the digital, tech, media and marcomms industries.

Title: Graduate Data Analyst
Description:
Our Emerging Talent Programme at Enstar is designed to build a great foundation in data analytics and machine learning within the insurance industry. It combines technical training, real-world business exposure, and structured development to support a successful transition from education to career. Over two years, participants will take part in tailored learning opportunities, rotational placements, and mentoring to develop critical thinking, data proficiency, and cross-functional awareness.




About the Role




This position sits within the Data Office. The team supports data-driven decision making across the organisation and contributes to developing ethical, responsible artificial intelligence capabilities




Responsibilities




Conducting statistical analysis and applying machine learning techniques to insurance and financial data
Supporting data preparation and transformation for analytical purposes
Developing, testing, and refining predictive models
Presenting insights to stakeholders and translating analytical outputs into business context
Collaborating with engineers and analysts across departments
Contributing to projects related to responsible AI, governance, and compliance







Qualifications




Candidates should have or be expecting to achieve a degree in a subject area such as Data Science, Machine Learning, Statistics, Mathematics, Computer Science, or another quantitative field.




Required Skills




Familiarity with supervised and unsupervised learning (e.g. regression, classification, clustering)
Basic experience in Python, R, or SQL, and familiarity with libraries such as Scikit-learn, TensorFlow, or PyTorch
Experience with data visualisation tools such as Power BI or Tableau
Awareness of data privacy, responsible AI, and ethical technology practices
Ability to convey technical ideas clearly and work collaboratively







Preferred Skills




Our graduates follow a structured development framework that includes:

Formal training aligned to a professional qualification
Technical and behavioural skills workshops
Real business assignments and rotations
Regular feedback and access to mentoring from experienced professionals




Pay range and compensation package




We offer a comprehensive package to support wellbeing, financial planning, and professional development. Benefits include:




10% employer pension contribution
Â£700 annual wellness reimbursement
Private medical and dental insurance
Health screening and wellbeing support
Cycle to Work scheme and electric vehicle lease
â€Employee Assistance Programme
Volunteering days and inclusive events

Enstar is committed to creating an inclusive, respectful, and accessible workplace. We support candidates from all backgrounds and provide support and adjustments throughout the recruitment process. Applicants who require accommodations are encouraged to let us know at any stage. Enstar is an equal opportunity employer. We believe diversity of thought and experience strengthens decision-making and performance.




Recruitment Process

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
DRW is a diversified trading firm with over 3 decades of experience bringing sophisticated technology and exceptional people together to operate in markets around the world. We value autonomy and the ability to quickly pivot to capture opportunities, so we operate using our own capital and trading at our own risk.

Headquartered in Chicago with offices throughout the U.S., Canada, Europe, and Asia, we trade a variety of asset classes including Fixed Income, ETFs, Equities, FX, Commodities and Energy across all major global markets. We have also leveraged our expertise and technology to expand into three non-traditional strategies: real estate, venture capital and cryptoassets.

We operate with respect, curiosity and open minds. The people who thrive here share our belief that itâ€™s not just what we do that mattersâ€“it's how we do it. DRW is a place of high expectations, integrity, innovation and a willingness to challenge consensus.

As a Data Analyst you will play an integral role in all operational aspects of onboarding, managing and maintaining various datasets used by traders and quantitative researchers. You will work closely with a variety of stakeholders, including technology, front office, operations, research, and risk management. You should be comfortable investigating complex data support issues in a fast-paced environment

What You Will Do In This Role


Help verify, clean, and ensure data is accurate and consistent across systems used for research and analysis by the various trading teams globally
Analyse datasets in order to draw conclusions and provide insight to address stakeholder or project-related questions
Collect metrics and analyse datasets across different dimensions of data quality including; completeness, validity, accuracy, timeliness, and consistency
Perform preliminary root cause analysis of data quality issues
Monitor and work through production data issues whilst engaging key stakeholders across multiple teams and facilitating global support
Assist the wider team by identifying opportunities for improving existing data pipelines


What You Will Need In This Role


Knowledge of a variety of financial instruments, in particular exposure to derivatives instruments
Experience working with SQL
Experience with cloud storage solutions
Prior experience documenting complex processes. Ideally some exposure to Confluence
Python programming skills: PySpark, Pandas, Jupyter Notebooks
Ability to work in a fast-paced environment; strong communication skills are desirable


Additional skills or experience which enhance consideration for this role


Prior experience developing data quality checks using Python
Familiarity with compressed/optimized file formats for data storage such as Parquet and HDF5
Prior experience working with Bloomberg Terminal
Familiarity with Linux and basic Bash scripting skills
Prior experience working with version control software
Experience with workflow management tools (Airflow / Argo)


For more information about DRW's processing activities and our use of job applicants' data, please view our Privacy Notice at https://drw.com/privacy-notice.

California residents, please review the California Privacy Notice for information about certain legal rights at https://drw.com/california-privacy-notice.

Title: Junior Analyst
Description:
We are looking for an innovative, analytical thinker to join our Gas Operations team. Are you looking to build the foundations of a strong, fast-paced career in the energy industry with a growing independent energy supplier?




What Will I Do?

As a Junior Operations Analyst you will be responsible for the analysis and interpretation of data from a variety of sources, identifying anomalies as appropriate. Working alongside internal stakeholders, and a number of third-parties you will support the resolution of customersâ€™ queries, always ensuring customer data is up-to-date and accurately reflects our billing systems.




What Skills Do I Need?

This role would be ideally suited to someone who is highly numerate with a great eye for detail and is comfortable working with large datasets. Ideally you will already have a working knowledge of Microsoft Excel and be able to learn our internal database systems and processes.




What can we offer?

This role offers a competitive package of remuneration along with access to a wide range of company benefits which includes;

Private medical insurance, including 24/7 GP appointments and access to a wide range of professional support. We also offer a life assurance and income protection scheme from day one!
Our annual company profit share scheme, rewarding everyone at Corona by sharing in our success.
Employee self-sacrifice Electric Vehicle scheme, with a wide range of different models to choose from â€“ supporting our commitment to the energy transition.
Access to thousands of retail and entertainment discounts through our internal rewards and recognition scheme, all linked to our company values.




On top of these great benefits, we also continue to invest in our people through a wealth of development opportunities, supporting you to get the most from your career!




Working Pattern

In this role you will be able to work on a hybrid pattern, with Tues-Thurs in the office and Monday and Friday at home. Our standard office hours are 0830 â€“ 1700, Monday to Friday.




Working with us at Corona Energy

At Corona Energy we are driven by our company culture which is focused around our core values; Empowered, Forward Thinking and Impactful â€“ these are underpinned by our central value â€œCustomer Firstâ€. This year we were proud to have been independently certified as one of the Best Places to Work in the UK with over 80% of our team recognising our outstanding employee experience!




To support this experience, we also offer our team;

Amazing office spaces, with complimentary breakfast, fruit, snacks and drinks throughout the day.
An annual focus on wellbeing with events and activities to support your health, wealth and inner-self!
An opportunity to support our charity partners, or to give back to important causes by fundraising or volunteering our time.
The chance to celebrate success together, at one of our regular sports and social events or at our annual company awards.




If you are looking for a career that is all about positive energy, we would welcome your application!




Corona Energy is a Disability Confident employer and as such will offer any successful applicant whatever reasonable adjustments they may require in order to take part in our recruitment process.

Title: Business Analyst - Data
Description:
Job Introduction

This role will sit in our Technology function partnering closely with our Product organisation and the Business. A key part of this role is to help develop our Agile mindset that facilitates regular, repeatable and reliable change across technology platforms, in line with the Technology strategy and roadmap. As a business analyst you will work in close collaboration with the business, product and engineering to analyse, review, define and shape new technology solutions, and be responsible for the requirements definition and analysis for new technology products and platforms. Specifically, this role will have a strong data focus and support Selfridges Enterprise Data & Finance data squads and initiatives.

As The Business Analyst You Will


Plan and estimate the business analysis activities and deliverables required within a given initiative.
Support Product with the definition and documentation of the business problem or opportunity and contribute to establishing the business case and gaining commitment to the change.
Work with the Business, Product and Engineering teams to identify and define the requirements using multiple techniques including (but not limited to) workshops, observation, interviews and creation of workflow models.
Work as part of a technology Squad and being actively involved in backlog refinement, sprint planning, sprint reviews, retrospectives and the daily stand-up (including demos/showcases) and ensure all projects have the required assets at the appropriate stages of the delivery lifecycle.
Elicit, validate, refine and manage the requirements within a given initiative, including defining the non-functional requirements, using appropriate tools and techniques.
Ensure that all requirements are well structured, clear and defined, with each requirement having valid and complete acceptance criteria.
Develop and document data mapping specifications to specify how source data is mapped to target systems data, along with the required business & transformation rules.
Perform data gap analysis of key problem areas to assist in root cause analysis.
Demonstrate an understanding of SQL, relational databases, reporting tools (e.g. Power BI) and have experience of data modelling and cataloguing tools.
Manage the risks and issues associated with requirements definition and the broader business analysis activities.
Collaborate with the Business and Product teams to agree, define and document the business processes associated with all new solutions inc. â€œas-isâ€ business process analysis, aligned to industry (BPMN) and Selfridges standards.
Manage and track requirements as they move from discovery through to implementation. Identify when new requirements change the scope of the overall solution and ensure that the appropriate change control processes are followed, including accurate impact assessment.
Collaborate with the Quality Engineering team to validate the test scenarios defined by them, ensure the appropriate level of test coverage is in place and that exception scenarios are well thought through against the requirements and support the quality activities through the delivery lifecycle.
Actively support the UAT (e.g. test case creation) and provide knowledge and expertise to support defect resolution.
Actively support (and undertake where necessary) business change activities e.g. training.
Fully understand the implementation of existing solutions within the domain and how they fit with the overall systems architecture.
Understand modern technology concepts, grasp new ones quickly and appreciate their implications on delivery.
Proven experience of delivering high quality, customer focused analysis in a complex and changing environment, in both Agile and Waterfall delivery environments.
You will report to a Senior Business Analyst and work closely with the broader IT community and third parties.
A passion for retail, heritage brands and a desire to learn deeply about our customer needs


How Youâ€™ll Do Itâ€¦you Will Have


Leadership. You hold yourself and others accountable to meet commitments and role model excellent behaviours and lead through both success and failure with a high focus on outcomes.
Judgement. Ability to make informed decisions based upon analysis, experience, and judgement, with data driven decisions at the fore.
Stakeholder Management. Comfortable challenging the status quo respectfully, providing advice to improve delivery. Ability to manage and engage multiple stakeholders providing the right updates and insight at the right points. Builds strong relationships and trust quickly at all levels of the organisation with both business and technical stakeholders.
Communication. An excellent communicator, both verbal and written. Ability to present information that it is engaging, well-structured and appropriate for the given audience.
Collaboration. Builds partnerships with internal and external stakeholders & suppliers and works collaboratively with others, bringing them together to meet shared objectives.
Problem Solving. Able to foresee and resolve potential bottlenecks, delays and barriers to delivery. Seeks solutions to problems in a practical and pragmatic way, demonstrating a logical and analytical approach.
Business Insight. Applies knowledge of the business and the marketplace to advance the organisation's goals. Demonstrates a customer focused mindset and a clear understanding of how own activities relate to critical business drivers and customer outcomes.
Action Oriented. Takes on new opportunities and tough challenges with a sense of urgency, high energy, and enthusiasm. Takes timely action on important or difficult issues. Identifies and pursues new opportunities that benefit the organization.
Passion for Business Analysis. Passionate and knowledgeable about Business Analysis and industry best practice. Someone who is keen to be actively involved and contribute to the Business Analysis community
Data Knowledge. Experience of working on data platform projects and knowledge of data solutions and systems. Be knowledgeable of different methodologies and best practices for data extraction, transformation, and load (e.g. ELT) between different applications and technologies.


Selfridges
Show more

Job Introduction

This role will sit in our Technology function partnering closely with our Product organisation and the Business. A key part of this role is to help develop our Agile mindset that facilitates regular, repeatable and reliable change across technology platforms, in line with the Technology strategy and roadmap. As a business analyst you will work in close collaboration with the business, product and engineering to analyse, review, define and shape new technology solutions, and be responsible for the requirements definition and analysis for new technology products and platforms. Specifically, this role will have a strong data focus and support Selfridges Enterprise Data & Finance data squads and initiatives.

As The Business Analyst You Will

  • Plan and estimate the business analysis activities and deliverables required within a given initiative.
  • Support Product with the definition and documentation of the business problem or opportunity and contribute to establishing the business case and gaining commitment to the change.
  • Work with the Business, Product and Engineering teams to identify and define the requirements using multiple techniques including (but not limited to) workshops, observation, interviews and creation of workflow models.
  • Work as part of a technology Squad and being actively involved in backlog refinement, sprint planning, sprint reviews, retrospectives and the daily stand-up (including demos/showcases) and ensure all projects have the required assets at the appropriate stages of the delivery lifecycle.
  • Elicit, validate, refine and manage the requirements within a given initiative, including defining the non-functional requirements, using appropriate tools and techniques.
  • Ensure that all requirements are well structured, clear and defined, with each requirement having valid and complete acceptance criteria.
  • Develop and document data mapping specifications to specify how source data is mapped to target systems data, along with the required business & transformation rules.
  • Perform data gap analysis of key problem areas to assist in root cause analysis.
  • Demonstrate an understanding of SQL, relational databases, reporting tools (e.g. Power BI) and have experience of data modelling and cataloguing tools.
  • Manage the risks and issues associated with requirements definition and the broader business analysis activities.
  • Collaborate with the Business and Product teams to agree, define and document the business processes associated with all new solutions inc. â€œas-isâ€ business process analysis, aligned to industry (BPMN) and Selfridges standards.
  • Manage and track requirements as they move from discovery through to implementation. Identify when new requirements change the scope of the overall solution and ensure that the appropriate change control processes are followed, including accurate impact assessment.
  • Collaborate with the Quality Engineering team to validate the test scenarios defined by them, ensure the appropriate level of test coverage is in place and that exception scenarios are well thought through against the requirements and support the quality activities through the delivery lifecycle.
  • Actively support the UAT (e.g. test case creation) and provide knowledge and expertise to support defect resolution.
  • Actively support (and undertake where necessary) business change activities e.g. training.
  • Fully understand the implementation of existing solutions within the domain and how they fit with the overall systems architecture.
  • Understand modern technology concepts, grasp new ones quickly and appreciate their implications on delivery.
  • Proven experience of delivering high quality, customer focused analysis in a complex and changing environment, in both Agile and Waterfall delivery environments.
  • You will report to a Senior Business Analyst and work closely with the broader IT community and third parties.
  • A passion for retail, heritage brands and a desire to learn deeply about our customer needs

How Youâ€™ll Do Itâ€¦you Will Have

  • Leadership. You hold yourself and others accountable to meet commitments and role model excellent behaviours and lead through both success and failure with a high focus on outcomes.
  • Judgement. Ability to make informed decisions based upon analysis, experience, and judgement, with data driven decisions at the fore.
  • Stakeholder Management. Comfortable challenging the status quo respectfully, providing advice to improve delivery. Ability to manage and engage multiple stakeholders providing the right updates and insight at the right points. Builds strong relationships and trust quickly at all levels of the organisation with both business and technical stakeholders.
  • Communication. An excellent communicator, both verbal and written. Ability to present information that it is engaging, well-structured and appropriate for the given audience.
  • Collaboration. Builds partnerships with internal and external stakeholders & suppliers and works collaboratively with others, bringing them together to meet shared objectives.
  • Problem Solving. Able to foresee and resolve potential bottlenecks, delays and barriers to delivery. Seeks solutions to problems in a practical and pragmatic way, demonstrating a logical and analytical approach.
  • Business Insight. Applies knowledge of the business and the marketplace to advance the organisation's goals. Demonstrates a customer focused mindset and a clear understanding of how own activities relate to critical business drivers and customer outcomes.
  • Action Oriented. Takes on new opportunities and tough challenges with a sense of urgency, high energy, and enthusiasm. Takes timely action on important or difficult issues. Identifies and pursues new opportunities that benefit the organization.
  • Passion for Business Analysis. Passionate and knowledgeable about Business Analysis and industry best practice. Someone who is keen to be actively involved and contribute to the Business Analysis community
  • Data Knowledge. Experience of working on data platform projects and knowledge of data solutions and systems. Be knowledgeable of different methodologies and best practices for data extraction, transformation, and load (e.g. ELT) between different applications and technologies.

Selfridges

The Role

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Introduction

Join us at Gallagher Re, the trailblazers of the reinsurance world, where every day brings new opportunities to shape the future. We empower our clients with cutting-edge analytics and insights, providing them the confidence to make strategic decisions that transform industries. As a team member, you'll be at the forefront of innovation, translating data into impactful solutions and taking the reins of your career like never before.

We believe that every candidate brings something special to the table, including you! So, even if you feel that youâ€™re close but not an exact match, we encourage you to apply.

Overview

Gallagher Re are looking to hire an experienced insurance Senior Data Analyst to join our growing analytics team.

This opportunity will play a critical role in delivering sophisticated data analysis to support the placement of insurance and reinsurance programs for our clients across various lines of business and territories.

Gallagher Re's Data and Analytics team is instrumental in driving innovation and delivering strategic value through data. Their expertise in analytics and commitment to excellence positions Gallagher Re as a leader in the reinsurance industry.

This role will be based from our London office with an expectation of being on site two days per week.

How You'll Make An Impact


Collaborate with brokers and clients to understand data requirements and provide advanced data-driven insights to support insurance and reinsurance placements.
Utilise advanced data analysis techniques and visualisation tools to analyse large and complex datasets, providing insights on market trends, claims experience, loss ratios, and other key performance indicators.
Develop and optimise data pipelines using Microsoft Azure Data Factory and other Azure tools to ensure efficient data processing and analysis.
Design and implement analytical tools and dashboards to support strategic data-driven decision-making across the organisation.
Lead the development and implementation of robust data quality checks and controls to ensure data accuracy and completeness.
Stay at the forefront of industry trends and emerging technologies in data analysis, visualisation, and data pipelining.
Contribute to the development of bespoke client data models


About You


Proven experience gained in a Senior Data Analyst/Engineering role, with a focus on technical data pipelining and analysis in the insurance or reinsurance industry.
Advanced proficiency in data analysis and visualisation tools such as SQL, Python, Power BI, and Microsoft Excel.
Extensive experience with Microsoft Azure toolkit, including data storage and analytics services such as Azure Data Lake, Azure Data Factory, and Azure Analysis Services.
Excellent problem-solving skills and meticulous attention to detail.
Excellent communication and presentation skills with the ability to convey complex technical concepts to non-technical audiences.
Ability to work independently and manage multiple priorities in a fast-paced, deadline-driven environment.
A degree in a related field such as statistics, mathematics, computer science, or engineering would be an advantage but is not essential.


Compensation And Benefits

On top of a competitive salary, great teams and exciting career opportunities, we also offer a wide range of benefits.

Below are the minimum core benefits youâ€™ll get, depending on your job level these benefits may improve:


Minimum of 25 days holiday, plus bank holidays, and the option to â€˜buyâ€™ extra days
Defined contribution pension scheme, which Gallagher will also contribute to
Life insurance, which will pay 4x your basic annual salary, which you can top-up to 10x
Income protection, weâ€™ll cover up to 50% of your annual income, with options to top up
Health cash plan or Private medical insurance


Other benefits include:


Three fully paid volunteering days per year
Employee Stock Purchase plan, offering company shares at a discount
Share incentive plan, HMRC approved, tax effective, stock purchase plan
Critical illness cover
Discounted gym membership, with over 3,000 gyms nationally
Season ticket loan
Access to a discounted voucher portal to save money on your weekly shop or next big purchase
Emergency back-up family care
And many moreâ€¦


We value inclusion and diversity

Inclusion and diversity (I&D) is a core part of our business, and itâ€™s embedded into the fabric of our organisation. For more than 95 years, Gallagher has led with a commitment to sustainability and to support the communities where we live and work.

Gallagher embraces our employeesâ€™ diverse identities, experiences and talents, allowing us to better serve our clients and communities. We see inclusion as a conscious commitment and diversity as a vital strength. By embracing diversity in all its forms, we live out The Gallagher Way to its fullest.

Gallagher is Disability Confident Committed. We have pledged to make sure our recruitment process is inclusive and accessible, in addition to supporting our existing employees with any long-term health conditions or disabilities.

We understand that applicants may have disabilities, if you do, you may find some parts of the recruitment process more challenging than others. Donâ€™t worry, weâ€™re here to help, however, we can only do this if you let us know.

Should you require reasonable adjustments to your application, please get in touch with TAGlobalSupport@ajg.com . If youâ€™d prefer to speak on the phone, please request a call back, leaving details, so we get in touch.

Our employing entity, Arthur J. Gallagher Services (UK) Limited, is proud to be accredited as a Living Wage employer with the Living Wage Foundation. We are committed to diversity and opportunity for all and are opposed to any form of less favourable treatment on the grounds of gender or gender identity, marital status, civil partnership status, parental status, race, ethnicity, colour, nationality, disability, sexual orientation, religion/ belief, age and those with caring responsibilities.

Gallagher believes that all persons are entitled to equal employment opportunity and prohibits any form of discrimination by its managers, employees, vendors or customers based on race, color, religion, creed, gender (including pregnancy status), sexual orientation, gender identity (which includes transgender and other gender non-conforming individuals), gender expression, hair expression, marital status, parental status, age, national origin, ancestry, disability, medical condition, genetic information, veteran or military status, citizenship status, or any other characteristic protected (herein referred to as â€œprotected characteristicsâ€) by applicable federal, state, or local laws.

Equal employment opportunity will be extended in all aspects of the employer-employee relationship, including, but not limited to, recruitment, hiring, training, promotion, transfer, demotion, compensation, benefits, layoff, and termination. In addition, Gallagher will make reasonable accommodations to known physical or mental limitations of an otherwise qualified person with a disability, unless the accommodation would impose an undue hardship on the operation of our business.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
The role

NatureMetrics is a global leader in biodiversity monitoring and environmental DNA (eDNA) analysis, transforming the scale at which nature can be quantified. Our cutting-edge solutions enable organisations to monitor nature impact across sectors, from conservation to industry and inform sustainability decisions with unprecedented accuracy. With a strong market leading position, NatureMetrics has established a robust client base and developed a proprietary software platform that makes biodiversity insights accessible, actionable and scalable. As Earthshot Prize Finalists 2024, BloombergNEF Pioneers 2024, World Economic Forum Technology Pioneers 2024 and TechNation Future Fifty 2025 cohort members, we have the potential and the opportunity to change the way organisations operate.

As we grow, we're looking for a Data Analyst to take the lead on analytical work that helps teams across the business make better, data-informed decisions.

In this role, youâ€™ll own analysis projects from start to finish, build clear and useful reports and dashboards, help prioritise analytics work and support the development of our internal data tools and infrastructure. Youâ€™ll also play a key part in improving data literacy across the company.

Itâ€™s a hands-on, cross-functional role where youâ€™ll collaborate with people across commercial, product, scientific and technical teams and have the chance to shape how data is used across the organisation.

Key Responsibilities

Leading data analysis: Take the lead on analysis projects from scoping to delivery, supporting teams across the business, including commercial, product, science, operations and finance.

Managing analytics priorities: Work with different teams to understand their data needs, help set priorities and keep things aligned with overall business goals.

Building reports and dashboards: Develop internal reporting processes and build insightful dashboards using modern visualisation tools to give teams the information they need, when they need it.

Championing data literacy and best practice: Help colleagues across the business feel confident using data by sharing knowledge, offering support and establishingbest practices in data analysis.

Improving data infrastructure: Work with the data engineering team to build and maintain robust, well-structured data pipelines and help shape our internal data tools by promoting good practices around data quality, documentation and automation.

Collaborating with data science and machine learning team: Support exploratory data analysis to help validate hypotheses and inform the delivery of NatureMetrics' AI and machine learning roadmap.

About You

Weâ€™re looking for someone whoâ€™s curious, thrives in a collaborative, cross functional environment, and has a genuine interest in how businesses operate and how data can be used to make better decisions.

You Will Bring


Prior experience as a data analyst working independently within a commercial organisation.
Proficiency in using SQL and Python for data analysis.
Experience working with cloud platforms, ideally Google Cloud Platform (GCP) and BigQuery.
Familiarity with modern data visualisation tools (e.g. Looker, Metabase, Power BI or similar).
Knowledge of software development best practices such as version control (Git), code testing, and documentation.
An understanding of data engineering workflows and principles (e.g. modelling data assets, data orchestration, ETL/ELT processes).
Awareness of data science and machine learning workflows is desirable.
Excellent communication and stakeholder management skills, with the ability to distill complex ideas for diverse audiences.
A collaborative mindset and a desire to work cross-functionally across a purpose-driven business.


Desirable But Not Required


Experience working with software as a service (SaaS) products.
Familiarity with bioinformatics, life sciences or geospatial data.
Experience with CRM or ERP systems.


What's In It For You


Competitive Salary
Impactful work with a purpose-driven team
Flexible work arrangements
Opportunities for professional growth
Benefits package including salary sacrifice pension scheme prioritising sustainability; life assurance; Health insurance; Enhanced annual leave; Cycle to Work Scheme; enhanced family friendly policy.


Why us?

At NatureMetrics diversity and inclusion are part of our DNA. Together, we continue to build an inclusive culture that encourages, supports, and celebrates the diverse voices of our employees. It fuels our innovation and connects us to the communities we work with. Our values leave no space for stereotypes. We are all unique and pull together for a common purpose.

About Us

Backed by ambitious investors, we're on a mission to make biodiversity measurable at scale to underpin global goals and accelerate finance into nature. NatureMetrics combines tech and AI to derive simple insights from the full complexity of nature on the ground.

We're a dynamic team passionate about nature and biodiversity and we take immense pride in our work and our impact. Join us on this journey!
Show more

The role

NatureMetrics is a global leader in biodiversity monitoring and environmental DNA (eDNA) analysis, transforming the scale at which nature can be quantified. Our cutting-edge solutions enable organisations to monitor nature impact across sectors, from conservation to industry and inform sustainability decisions with unprecedented accuracy. With a strong market leading position, NatureMetrics has established a robust client base and developed a proprietary software platform that makes biodiversity insights accessible, actionable and scalable. As Earthshot Prize Finalists 2024, BloombergNEF Pioneers 2024, World Economic Forum Technology Pioneers 2024 and TechNation Future Fifty 2025 cohort members, we have the potential and the opportunity to change the way organisations operate.

As we grow, we're looking for a Data Analyst to take the lead on analytical work that helps teams across the business make better, data-informed decisions.

In this role, youâ€™ll own analysis projects from start to finish, build clear and useful reports and dashboards, help prioritise analytics work and support the development of our internal data tools and infrastructure. Youâ€™ll also play a key part in improving data literacy across the company.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Reward & People Data Analyst

Location: Central London (close to Tottenham Court Road)

Salary: Up to Â£60,000 + Generous Bonus

Industry: Global Investment & Advisory Group




Are you a data-driven professional with a passion for reward, analytics, and compensation strategy? A leading global investment and advisory group is looking for a Reward & People Data Analyst to join their dynamic HR team in the heart of London.




About the Role

In this pivotal role, youâ€™ll be instrumental in shaping and enhancing the firmâ€™s reward structures and supporting the annual compensation cycle. Key Responsibilities

Provide analytical support for reward-related projects, policies, and processes

Maintain and develop dashboards and reports to support reward and workforce analytics using Excel and Power BI

Ensure data accuracy and integrity across all people-related systems and reporting processes




What Weâ€™re Looking For

Strong background in HR data analytics or reward/compensation roles
Exceptional Excel skills; experience using Power BI is highly desirable
Comfortable working with large, complex data sets
Detail-oriented with strong problem-solving capabilities
A collaborative mindset and the ability to communicate effectively with both technical and non-technical stakeholders
Experience working within financial or professional services environments is a plus




Whatâ€™s on Offer

Salary up to Â£60,000 (DOE)
Generous performance-related bonus
Opportunity to work within a respected, global organisation
Collaborative and high-performing team culture
Hybrid working environment




Interested?

If you're looking to take the next step in your reward analytics career and join a business where your insights will shape strategic outcomes, weâ€™d love to hear from you.

Title: Insights Analyst
Description:
Company Overview

RFI Global is the only global insights company focusing exclusively on financial services. We empower financial service leaders with the market intelligence they need to drive innovation and accelerate growth.

Partnering with the world's top financial institutions, our expert team delivers tailored insights through a unique hybrid syndicated approach, drawing from over 200,000 consumer and 60,000 business interviews each year.

The Role

The Insights Analyst will be a key member of our dynamic and fast paced research team, creating critical business and market insights that our clients rely on to measure their performance and direct their strategy.

You will gain experience in analysing voice of the customer data, secondary macro data, and corporate case studies. This will provide a base from which you will be trained as an expert in financial services insights, with opportunities to present your findings directly to clients as you grow within the company. This is a fast-paced role where you will be rewarded for your commitment and learning ability.

Importantly, you will see the impact of your work on the largest and most innovative global, regional and national banks.

Start Date: 1 July 2025

Key Responsibilities


Analysis of primary consumer data to provide recommendations and propose actions for client's strategic decision-making
Analysis of secondary data (economic, financial etc) to contextualise RFI's primary research and compile case studies of best practice
Designing questionnaires and supporting with project management during fieldwork
Accurate creation and detailed review of sensitive performance metrics used by our clients within core functions of their institutions, and for market updates
Creating presentation decks which convey complex data in a clear and compelling story for non-technical audiences
Keeping across client briefs and attending client calls, with a view to developing presentation skills
Cross-functional collaboration with team members, including sales, marketing, client services, operations and research teams in our Singapore, London and Sydney offices
Communication of ideas, thinking outside the box and challenging the status quo



Requirements


Essential


Be a self-starter with a positive attitude
Demonstrate curiosity and a problem-solving mindset
Apply critical thinking to every task you take on
Have excellent verbal and written communication skills
Thrive in a fast-paced environment and be comfortable with a steep learning curve
Able to work both autonomously and in a team
Enjoy working in an open and collaborative environment
Be confident multi-tasking and managing multiple deadlines


We welcome applicants from all degree backgrounds.

Desirable

The following skills will be highly regarded but are not essential as full on-the-job training will be provided:


Knowledge of or interest in market research
Knowledge of or interest in the banking and payments industry
Experience with using Q, SPSS, or any other statistical analysis software
Experience using Microsoft Office programs, particularly PowerPoint and Excel



Benefits


Great opportunity to work with a global team
25 days annual leave + public holidays + birthday leave +2 charity days
Hybrid working model with up to 3 remote days per week
Regular employee awards
Monthly breakfast and quarterly social events
Learning and development budget to help your professional growth
Yearly personal wellness fund
Private healthcare
Loyalty leave after 5 years of service
Perkbox
Show more
